0.title: Deepak Chahar gives 'mankad' warning to South Africa batter, smiles at him; video goes viral
0.article_body: During the 16th over of South Africa's innings in the third T20I, Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar stopped mid-way during his run-up seeing non-striker Tristan Stubbs leaving his crease. Chahar then warned Stubbs about 'mankading' and smiled at him. Notably, 'mankading' has been shifted from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out' in MCC rules effective October 1.

1.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 announced, only 1 Indian included
1.article_body: The ICC has announced 20 match officials (16 umpires and four match referees) for the first round and Super 12 stages of ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. Nitin Menon is the only match official from India to have been included. Marais Erasmus, Rodney Tucker and Aleem Dar will appear in their seventh ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

2.title: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' crosses ₹250 cr worldwide in 4 days
2.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' has crossed the ₹250-crore mark at the worldwide box office within four days of its release. The film was released in theatres across the globe in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada. 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' stars Vikram, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Trisha and Karthi, among others.

3.title: Was disheartened, 'Adipurush' meant for big screen: Director on trolling
3.article_body: Director Om Raut said that he was disheartened by people's reaction to the teaser of his upcoming film 'Adipurush'. "[I'm] not surprised because the film is made for...the big screen...Given a choice, I'd never put it on YouTube but that's the need of the hour," he added. Twitter users trolled the film's VFX after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released.

4.title: PM Modi shares video of boy giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit
4.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared a video where a boy can be heard giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit. "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort," the PM tweeted. The now-viral video shows few children playing cricket on a street. PM Modi also shared another video of a person giving cricket commentary in Sanskrit in Kashi.

5.title: Bajrang Dal activists barge into garba event in Guj, beat up bouncers
5.article_body: Some people said to be from Bajrang Dal barged into a garba event in Gujarat's Surat on Monday and attacked bouncers there. Two of the bouncers were injured in the incident. "We have deployed police staff at same garba event and extra police [force] has been deployed to prevent any untoward incident," the Deputy Commissioner said.

6.title: Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' to be screened at Busan Film Festival
6.article_body: Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' will be screened at the 27th Busan International Film Festival. Turmeric Media, the co-producer of the film, took to Twitter to announce the screening. The film, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, also featured Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil. Busan International Film Festival will take place from October 5 to October 14.

7.title: Will take 4-5 yrs to resolve stubble burning: Punjab pollution control body
7.article_body: It will take four to five years to resolve the stubble burning issue in Punjab, a state Pollution Control Board official said. He added, "Crop diversification is not a long term solution because it does not mean that biomass will not be produced by other crops.'' Crop diversification is among several initiatives the Centre proposed to resolve stubble burning.

8.title: Jemimah, Deepti batted well to help us get back in the game vs UAE: Mandhana
8.article_body: Praising Jemimah Rodrigues(75*) and Deepti Sharma(64) following India's 104-run win against  United Arab Emirates at Women's Asia Cup, India stand-in skipper Smriti Mandhana said, "Jemimah and Deepti batted really well to help us get back in the game." Jemimah and Deepti added a 128-run fourth-wicket partnership after India were reduced to 20/3 inside the fifth over.

9.title: Viral photo from US shows windows that didn't shatter during Hurricane Ian
9.article_body: A photo showing windows that didn't shatter amid Hurricane Ian that hit US' Florida has gone viral. The photo is from Naples and it was shared by Dixie Whatley, who is a former TV journalist. It shows water reaching a great height outside her windows. However, the window panes didn't shatter and prevented the flood water from gushing in.

10.title: Empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications: EC
10.article_body: The Election Commission told political parties that empty poll promises have far-reaching ramifications and that it can't overlook inadequate disclosures. The EC also asked political parties to provide authentic information to assess their financial viability and also to seek the views of the voters. The disclosure seeks to assess availability of the financial resources to implement the promises.

11.title: Kerala firm makes ₹5 crore profit by selling 7,382 tonnes of waste
11.article_body: Clean Kerala Company Limited (CKCL) has reported a profit of ₹5 crore by selling 7,382 tonnes of dry and recyclable waste. CKCL generated the profit within 20 months of launching operations in January 2021. It also collected and sold 1,972 tonnes of e-waste to recycling and processing units. CKCL is a joint venture of the state government and local bodies.

12.title: PM speaks with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, discusses ongoing conflict
12.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held a telephonic conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. PM Modi reiterated his call for early cessation of hostilities and the need to pursue the path of dialogue and diplomacy. He said India attaches importance to the safety and security of nuclear installations, including in Ukraine.

13.title: Politically motivated: Sisodia on probe ordered by Delhi L-G
13.article_body: Responding to Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena's statement that they will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia called the orders "politically motivated, illegal and unconstitutional". Sisodia, in a letter to Saxena, said that the Delhi government has the right to make decisions in all fields except land, police, public order and services.

14.title: SphitiCap launches maiden early-stage fund of $500 mn
14.article_body: Venture Capital firm SphitiCap has launched its maiden early-stage fund with a $500 million corpus which it will invest in companies focusing on sustainability, growth and impact. SphitiCap was founded in 2022 and will invest an average of $10 million in Indian startups from the seed stage to Series A. It was founded by Pallav Kumar Singh and Mayank Mehra.

15.title: Container truck hits 3-wheeler vehicle in Gujarat; 5 killed, 4 injured
15.article_body: Five persons were killed and four others were injured after a container truck hit a three-wheeler ferrying passengers near Golden Chowki in Vadodara, Gujarat. The truck lost balance after hitting a car and jumped on the wrong side of the road after breaking the divider and crashed into the three-wheeler, police said. The truck was coming from Surat.

16.title: Himachal CM reviews preparations ahead of PM Modi's visit on Oct 5
16.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday reviewed arrangements and preparations ahead of PM Narendra Modi's programme in Bilaspur on October 5. PM Modi will inaugurate the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Bilaspur and lay the foundation stone for projects worth over ₹3,650 crore. "PM will also participate in Kullu Dussehra," CM Jairam Thakur said.

17.title: Video shows woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' at Ramleela in UP; 10 booked
17.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a woman dancing to 'Kanta Laga' song at a Ramleela event in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. A case has been registered against 10 members of the Ramleela committee, police said on Tuesday. The members have also been warned against indulging in any such action again, the Additional Superintendent of Police said.

18.title: Sara Ali Khan to play a freedom fighter in 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
18.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram to announce that Sara Ali Khan will play the lead role in an upcoming film, titled 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'. He mentioned that Sara will play a freedom fighter in a fictional tale set against the backdrop of the Quit India Movement in 1942. The film will go on the floors this month.

19.title: Arjun Kapoor in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule': Reports
19.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor is reportedly in talks to star in 'Pushpa: The Rule', the sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise'. According to reports, Arjun Kapoor may play the role of a police officer in the film. Actors Fahadh Faasil and Rashmika Mandanna will also return for the sequel, which will be directed by Sukumar.

20.title: Bengaluru hospital warns mothers their babies may get kidnapped: Report
20.article_body: New mothers in West Bengaluru's Vani Vilas government hospital are reportedly being told to "hold on to their babies at all times, otherwise, they might get kidnapped". Hospital staff especially nurses and security guards are warning the mothers. A medical officer reportedly said such 'announcements' are routine and take place in all hospitals.

21.title: Increase in tea prices to offset impact of wage rate hike: Report
21.article_body: An ICRA report said that an increase in tea prices following global supply issues will likely offset the impact of increased wage rates in West Bengal and Assam. ICRA said that overall financial performance will likely see a year-on-year improvement in FY23. The report said that orthodox tea prices are at all-time high due to production disruptions in Sri Lanka.

22.title: 3-year-old US water startup 'Liquid Death' valued at $700 million
22.article_body: Three-year-old US-based startup 'Liquid Death', which sells water in beer-style cans, is now valued at $700 million. It raised $70 million in its latest funding round led by Science Ventures, with participation from other investors including music group Swedish House Mafia and comedian Whitney Cummings. Its investors believe it's the fastest growing non-alcoholic beverage of all time.

23.title: UPI payments cross ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022
23.article_body: Payments made through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) crossed the ₹11-lakh-crore mark in September 2022, as per National Payments Corporation of India's data. In September, 678 crore transactions, in volume terms, were carried out. As many as 657.9 crore transactions worth ₹10.72 lakh crore had taken place in August, up from 628.8 crore transactions worth ₹10.62 lakh crore in July.

24.title: Govt approves ₹26,000 crore to install 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days
24.article_body: According to a telecom ministry spokesperson, the government has approved ₹26,000 crore for installation of 25,000 mobile towers in 500 days. The spokesperson added that financial support for the project will be provided by Universal Services Obligation Fund. The project was announced by Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw at the recent 'Digital India Conference of State IT Ministers'.

25.title: TRS leader distributes liquor, live chicken ahead of launch of T'gana CM's new party
25.article_body: TRS leader Rajanala Srihari on Tuesday distributed liquor bottles and live chicken to public ahead of launch of new party by Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao. Srihari reportedly distributed about 200 bottles of alcohol and 200 chicken as part of the celebrations. A video showed a long queue waiting to receive liquor bottles and chicken from Srihari.

26.title: BSF seizes heroine from Pakistani truck in Amritsar
26.article_body: The BSF has seized 435 grams of heroin concealed in a Pakistani truck transporting dry fruits from Afghanistan at the Integrated Check-Post in Attari in Punjab's Amritsar district. The contraband was allegedly smuggled from Pakistan and was attached to an iron plate wrapped in black adhesive tape with a magnet to the back mud-guard, the BSF said.

27.title: BBMP to appoint 9 officers to handle floods, other disasters: Report
27.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will reportedly appoint nine disaster management officers to handle flood scenarios in the city. The BBMP already has one position for coordinator for disaster management, however, it is currently vacant. After floods affected the city in September this year, the BBMP now reportedly intends to create a special unit for catastrophe management.

28.title: Ear of Hindu priest chewed off during argument in Indore; 3 arrested
28.article_body: A Hindu priest's ear was chewed off, following an altercation with members of a family in Indore, MP. The family had invited the priest, Kunj Bihari Sharma,  to their house to perform a Puja where the incident happened, police said. Three persons, Lakshminarayan Sharma and his two sons Vipul and Arun, have been arrested in this connection.

29.title: Reliance, Sanmina sign deal to set up electronics manufacturing joint venture
29.article_body: Reliance Industries' subsidiary RSBVL and US-based Sanmina Corporation have completed the deal to set up an electronics manufacturing joint venture at a total enterprise valuation of about ₹3,300 crore. RSBVL will invest up to ₹1,670 crore in new shares in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The day-to-day business will continue to be managed by Sanmina's management team in Chennai.

30.title: Russian who masterminded JEE 2021 paper leak sent to CBI custody
30.article_body: The Russian national who is said to be the mastermind behind the JEE (Mains) 2021 exam paper leak case was on Tuesday sent to CBI custody for two days by a Delhi court. The CBI informed the court that it will question the accused, Mikhail Shargin, about the data present in his phone, laptop and external hard disk.

31.title: Rahul was asked to request me to withdraw from Cong prez poll: Tharoor
31.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said on Tuesday that some party leaders had asked Rahul Gandhi to seek withdrawal of his candidature from Congress Presidential polls. "He told me he will not do so. He said I should not withdraw and that I should contest in the election," Tharoor said. Never expected big leaders to support me, Tharoor had earlier said.

32.title: Sony India-Zee Entertainment merger approved with modifications: CCI
32.article_body: Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved merger of Zee Entertainment Enterprises with Culver Max Entertainment, formerly known as Sony Pictures Networks. CCI said the merger was approved with "certain modifications". The firms have reportedly been asked by CCI to ensure they don't misuse market dominance resulting out of the merger. Zee and Sony had announced merger last year.

33.title: Will impose costs on perpetrators of violence in Iran: US Prez
33.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said his country will be "imposing further costs on perpetrators of violence against peaceful protestors" in Iran. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 21-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". In a statement on Monday, Biden said, "We will continue holding Iranian officials accountable."

34.title: 20 killed, 36 wounded as al-Shabaab attacks Somali govt centre
34.article_body: Militant group al-Shabaab has attacked a government centre in Somalia's Hiran region, killing 20 people and injuring 36 others, officials said. Hirshabelle Health Minister and the Deputy Governor of Hiran were killed in the attack on Monday. The attack comes after the US said it had killed a top al-Shabaab leader in an airstrike in Somalia on October 1.

35.title: Jio to launch 5G trials in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Varanasi from tomorrow
35.article_body: Reliance Jio has announced that it will begin a beta trial of its 5G services in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Varanasi from October 5, 2022. Jio will allow users to experience 5G speeds of up to 1Gbps in these regions. The telecom operator said that it will conduct more 5G trials in other regions "as cities keep getting ready".

36.title: IAF has taken steps to deal with China at LAC: Air Chief Marshal
36.article_body: Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari said the Indian Air Force has taken "non-escalatory" measures to deal with Chinese activities along the LAC in eastern Ladakh. He added that they are prepared for all kinds of security challenges including "worst-case scenario". The Air Chief Marshal said the return to normal would happen only with a return to status quo ante.

37.title: India declares Hizb-Ul-Mujahideen commander Showkat Ahmad a terrorist
37.article_body: The Indian government on Tuesday declared the Chief Launching Commander of Hizb-Ul-Mujahideen, Showkat Ahmad Sheikh, a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 on charges of spreading terror violence in Jammu and Kashmir. Born in Baramulla, Showkat alias Showkat Mochi is based in Pakistan. Imtiyaz Ahmad Kandoo, another member of the outfit, has also been declared a terrorist.

38.title: EU, Israel hold 1st senior-level meeting in a decade
38.article_body: The European Union (EU) and Israeli representatives held senior-level talks on Monday, which is the first such meeting between the two sides in a decade. Ahead of the meeting, EU Diplomat Josep Borrell said the stalled Middle-East peace process and the situation in Palestine would be discussed. Quoting a United Nations report, he said the situation in Palestine was "worrisome''.

39.title: TRS leader distributes liquor, chickens ahead of launch of T'gana CM's new party
39.article_body: TRS leader Rajanala Srihari on Tuesday distributed liquor bottles and chickens to public ahead of launch of a new party by Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao. Srihari reportedly distributed about 200 bottles of alcohol and 200 chickens as part of the celebrations. A video showed a long queue waiting to receive liquor bottles and chickens from Srihari.

40.title: WWII reparations for Poland already settled: German Minister
40.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday said that Germany paying reparations for the World War II invasion of Poland was a matter already settled. A day earlier, Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau had signed an official document which sought around $1.3 trillion in reparations from Berlin. Baerbock said she had discussed the document in person with Rau.

41.title: No 'character certificate' required to cover PM's event: Himachal CM
41.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday withdrew the controversial order requiring a 'character certificate' of journalists to cover PM Narendra Modi's visit to the state on Wednesday. "I invite all journalists to cover PM's visit to the state on October 5," Thakur said, adding that PM will lay the foundation stone of various projects.

42.title: Films will make ₹4,000 cr if North & South come together: Salman Khan
42.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, speaking about North and South cinemas working together, said, "People talk about ₹300-400 crore, if we all get together, then we can cross ₹3,000-4,000 crore." Salman has a cameo in Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather'. "His (Chiranjeevi) fans go and watch me. My fans become his fans, his fans become my fans...everyone just grows...the numbers become very large," Salman added.

43.title: Man wears burqa to avoid money lenders in Mumbai, gets beaten
43.article_body: A man who wore a burqa to avoid money lenders was allegedly assaulted by a group of people on the suspicion of being a child-lifter in Mumbai. The incident took place on September 29, when the victim had gone to meet his brother in Dharavi. The man was saved from the group of people by Assistant Police Inspector Amol Chavhan.

44.title: Poland demands $1.3-trillion war reparations from Germany
44.article_body: Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau has signed an official document which seeks around $1.3 trillion in reparations from Germany for the World War II invasion of his country by the Nazis. Rau said the document will be sent to the Foreign Ministry of Germany. The development comes on the eve of German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock’s visit to Warsaw.

45.title: Bajaj Electronics IPO to remain open till October 7
45.article_body: The Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Electronic Mart India Limited, which operates outlets in the name of Bajaj Electronics, will remain open till October 7. The price band for a share of EMIL has been fixed ₹56-59. Out of the total lots, 50% is reserved for qualified institutional investors, 35% for retail investors, and 15% for non-institutional investors.

46.title: Jonny Bairstow reveals he broke his leg in 3 places in freak accident, shares pics
46.article_body: England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow took to Instagram to give his followers an update on his injury and progress. The 33-year-old revealed that he broke his leg in three places and dislocated his ankle in a freak accident while playing golf last month. Sharing pictures, Bairstow added that he is now three weeks post surgery and his staples have been removed.

47.title: Singer Murali Mohapatra collapses and dies while performing on stage in Odisha
47.article_body: Odia singer Murali Mohapatra collapsed and died while performing at a Durga Puja cultural event in Odisha's Koraput district. Mohapatra, who was reportedly unwell, suddenly sat down on a chair on the stage after singing four songs. When taken to hospital, he was declared dead on arrival. He died of a heart attack late on Sunday night, his brother said.

48.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against South Africa, make 3 changes
48.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against South Africa in the third T20I. India have made three changes to their playing XI. KL Rahul and Virat Kohli have been rested, while Arshdeep Singh misses out due to an issue with his back. They have been replaced by Shreyas Iyer, Mohammed Siraj and Umesh Yadav.

49.title: Wipro asks employees to come to office at least 3 days a week
49.article_body: Wipro's India offices will be open on Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays from October 10. The IT major said that it encourages employees to work from the office on at least three of these four days, Moneycontrol reported citing an e-mail from Wipro. "This will help us enjoy the camaraderie and team spirit of connecting in person," Wipro said.

50.title: I wanted to become a doctor: Ayushmann Khurrana
50.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who'll next be seen in 'Doctor G', revealed that he wanted to be a doctor. "I tried physics, chemistry, and bio in...11th and 12th...I've even given PMT exams, CBSE, PMT Karnataka CET, all these exams I'd gone through the drill," Ayushmann said, adding, "Not in real life, but at least I become a doctor in the film."

51.title: ED raids 12 Bengaluru entities over job scam involving Chinese citizens
51.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday conducted raids on 12 entities involved in a part-time job fraud case in Bengaluru and seized ₹5.85 crore from them. The raids were based on complaints that Chinese citizens had cheated people by collecting registration fees for part-time jobs. Police said the Chinese formed fake companies in India and recruited Indians to work for them.

52.title: Men who pelted stones at Guj garba event caned by police, video surfaces
52.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows police in Gujarat's Kheda district beating up two men accused of pelting stones during a garba event. In the video, the accused can be seen tied to a pillar and being beaten up by a wooden stick. Locals are seen applauding and cheering. The accused were taken to police station later.

53.title: Traffic constable gets 4 stitches after man slaps, hits him in Pune
53.article_body: A traffic constable received four stitches after a man assaulted him following a heated argument over parking his car in Pimpri Chinchwad near Pune. The accused reportedly slapped the constable and hit him on the face and head using his silver bangle (kada). Meanwhile, police have registered an FIR and arrested the accused.

54.title: Jemimah, Deepti's fifties help India beat UAE for 3rd straight win at Asia Cup
54.article_body: Jemimah Rodrigues' unbeaten 75-run knock and Deepti Sharma's 64 helped India defeat United Arab Emirates by 104 runs and win their third consecutive match at Women's Asia Cup 2022 on Tuesday. Opting to bat first, India put up a total of 178/5. UAE managed to score 74/4 in 20 overs. India are currently on top of the points table.

55.title: Madhuri Dixit buys an apartment on the 53rd floor in Mumbai for ₹48 crore
55.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has purchased an apartment in Mumbai for ₹48 crore, according to documents accessed by Zapkey.com. Located on the 53rd floor in Indiabulls Blu project, the apartment has an area of 5,384 sq ft and comes with seven car parking slots. In October last year, the actress rented a house for ₹12.5 lakh per month for three years.

56.title: We always prepare for worst-case scenario like Russia-Ukraine war: IAF chief
56.article_body: Indian Air Force (IAF) chief, Air Chief Marshal VK Chaudhari, said IAF always prepares for worst case scenario, like the Russia-Ukraine war. "Future conflicts can be short...high intensity. They can be protracted, low-intensity, probably what we're seeing [in Russia-Ukraine]...Predictability of what kind of conflicts India will face will be based on geopolitical situation around us," he said.

57.title: He is so jovial and lively: Satyadev on 'GodFather' co-star Salman
57.article_body: Actor Satyadev in an interview called his 'GodFather' co-star Salman Khan a "cool person", adding that the actor is very "jovial and lively". "Outside he is so different but inside he is such a cool dude. It felt so nice," Satyadev further said. Salman will make a cameo appearance in the upcoming film, which stars Chiranjeevi in the lead role.

58.title: Be careful with your words & actions: Tamil Nadu CM to DMK cadre
58.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin warned DMK cadre of stringent action if they bring disrepute to the party through their words or actions. In a letter written on Monday, Stalin urged members of the party to be cautious with what they speak and how they approach the people who meet them. "You should act with dignity and responsibility," Stalin said.

59.title: Ration card holders in Maha to get grocery package at ₹100 for Diwali
59.article_body: The Maharashtra Cabinet on Tuesday approved a Diwali package for ration card holders, Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said. The state will provide a package of groceries at ₹100 to ration card holders in Maharashtra for Diwali. The package will include 1 kg of semolina (rawa), groundnuts, edible oil and yellow lentils. The initiative will benefit seven crore people.

60.title: Threatening to kill her brother, man rapes 13-yr-old girl in Kerala
60.article_body: A 28-year-old migrant worker from West Bengal was arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a 13-year-old child in Kerala's Kottayam. The minor was reportedly sexually assaulted by the accused several times over the last six months. The victim's parents learned about the incident when she was found to be pregnant during a medical check-up.

61.title: World facing 'life-or-death struggle': Guterres on climate change
61.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has warned that the world is facing "a life-or-death struggle" as the emissions of greenhouse gases are at an all-time high. Speaking at a meeting in Kinshasa, Congo, on Monday, he accused the world's 20 richest countries of not doing enough. "Failure to act...will lead to more loss of trust and more climate damage," he said.

62.title: Muslim mob tried to attack temple: Police on Kheda stone pelting
62.article_body: A Muslim mob of over 200 people tried to disturb the garba function in Gujarat's Kheda, DSP Nadiad VR Bajpai said on Tuesday, adding that the mob also hurled stones inside a temple. "There were 150-200 people, including women, in the mob. The sarpanch has identified 43 people and gave a complaint against them," Bajpai added.

63.title: Indian men's team's 3-match unbeaten run comes to end at World Team TT C'ships
63.article_body: Indian men's table tennis team's three-match unbeaten run came to an end after a 0-3 loss against France in their fourth Group 2 tie at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China, on Tuesday. Both Manav Thakkar and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost their matches 0-3, while Harmeet Desai lost 2-3. India are currently third in the standings.

64.title: Guj in favour of power subsidy, BJP wants to stop it in Delhi: Kejriwal
64.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said, "Gujarat is liking AAP's guarantee of giving free electricity. That's why BJP wants to stop it in Delhi." "People of Delhi, have faith. I'll not let your free electricity stop under any circumstances," he tweeted. "People of Gujarat, I assure you...if [AAP's] government is formed, your electricity will also be free," he added.

65.title: Crew, flyers dance to Garba music at Bhopal airport; video goes viral
65.article_body: Crew and passengers of an IndiGo flight, along with security personnel, were seen at Bhopal's Raja Bhoj Airport dancing to garba songs. The flight was going to Ahmedabad and was delayed, and some of the staff danced when tunes were played on a mobile phone, an airport official said. A video of the dance went viral on social media.

66.title: 2 minors, aged 6 & 4, drown while bathing in pond in UP's Paniyara
66.article_body: Two minor siblings, aged six and four years, drowned in a pond in Kamta Bujurg village of Uttar Pradesh's Paniyara, police said. The incident occurred on Monday when Sagar and Garima were bathing in a pond located in front of their house and drowned, Circle Officer Ajai Singh Chauhan said. The bodies were fished out from the pond by villagers.

67.title: TikTok fined $50,000 by Russian court for not deleting LGBT content
67.article_body: A Russian court fined TikTok $50,000 for refusing to delete content that violates Russian law against spreading "LGBT propaganda". According to a report, representative of the social media platform insisted that proceedings be terminated. Amazon-owned Twitch was fined $68,000 for hosting an interview of Oleksiy Arestovych, who is an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

68.title: Google selects 20 Indian startups for women-focused accelerator
68.article_body: Google India selected 20 startups for the first cohort of its 'Google for Startups Accelerator-India Women Founders'. "This programme is part of a larger effort by Google towards improving representation of women across different sections of India's digitally-trained workforce," Google said. The curriculum has workshops on AI/ML, Cloud, UX, Android, Web, product strategy and growth, Google added.

69.title: 3 arrested for stealing motorcycle at gunpoint from highway in Gurugram
69.article_body: Three suspects were arrested for allegedly robbing a man of his motorcycle at gunpoint on Southern Peripheral Road in Gurugram last week. The victim, Ashok Kumar, was returning to Rampura after finishing his duty at a mall when the incident happened, police said. Suspects allegedly took away Kumar's mobile as well. However, the motorcycle has been recovered from the suspects.

70.title: Four Italians arrested for defacing metro coaches in Mumbai, Ahmedabad
70.article_body: The Ahmedabad Police arrested four Italian nationals on Sunday for drawing graffiti on two parked metro coaches in Gomtipur. Now, the Mumbai Police has also booked the four for trespassing the Charkop metro depot in an attempt to deface coaches last month. Police say the Italians have caused at least ₹50,000 worth of damage to public property in Gujarat.

71.title: Chain snatcher attacks woman’s face with a knife in Delhi; escapes
71.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was injured after being attacked on her face and back with a knife, allegedly by a man who robbed her gold chain and escaped on a motorcycle, Delhi Police said on Tuesday. The woman was returning home with her five-year-old son when she was attacked from behind by the accused, reports said.

72.title: India's rank in Global Innovation Index has improved: Prez Murmu
72.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday said that India's rank in the Global Innovation Index has risen from 81st to 40th. India was ranked 81st in 2015 Global Innovation Index. Speaking after launching 'herSTART', a platform for women entrepreneurs created by Gujarat University, Murmu said, "I'm informed...this university has over 450 start-ups. Out of which over 125 are headed by women."

73.title: Urvashi shares 'Happy Birthday' video with flying kiss, fans say it's for Rishabh Pant
73.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to share a video of her blowing a flying kiss with the caption, "Happy Birthday." With her uploading the video on the same day as Rishabh Pant's 25th birthday, several fans commented that the video is for Pant. "He won't reply," a fan joked. "What is this style of wishing?" wrote another.

74.title: 'Brahmastra' was boycotted, now it's a blockbuster: Riteish Deshmukh
74.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh said the boycott trend does not make a film flop. Citing the example of 'Brahmastra', Riteish stated, "It was boycotted and now it's a blockbuster." He added, "I believe everyone has a right to express their views, we just have to do our own work." 'Brahmastra' earned over ₹400 crore worldwide despite facing boycott calls on Twitter.

75.title: As a black person, I want to receive the respect that Serena had: Tiafoe
75.article_body: Talking about the legacy he wants to leave behind after his tennis career, US' Frances Tiafoe said as a black person, he wants to receive the respect that recently retired Serena Williams had. "When I finish my career, if many kids who look like me are playing tennis, then I'll feel like I've won. That's my biggest goal," he added.

76.title: Richa & Ali say they have been legally married for 2.5 years, registered wedding in 2020
76.article_body: The spokesperson of Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal, who are currently hosting their wedding festivities, has clarified that the couple has been legally married since 2020. "This is to clarify that [they] have been legally married for 2.5 years when they registered their wedding. Currently, they are celebrating their union with friends and family," the statement said.

77.title: SP founder Mulayam Singh's health still critical: Hospital
77.article_body: Ex-Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh's health condition is still critical. The 82-year-old is admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. The hospital said he is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists. SP in a statement said, "We all wish the respected Netaji a speedy recovery and long life."

78.title: NYU fires organic chemistry professor after students blame him for poor marks
78.article_body: The New York University (NYU) fired its organic chemistry professor, Maitland Jones Jr, after students complained that the course was "too hard" and blamed the professor for their poor test scores, The New York Times reported. As many as 82 of his 350 students signed a petition against him. Jones earlier taught chemistry at Princeton for more than 40 years.

79.title: Rahul Gandhi visits temple, mosque & church in K'taka, shares pics
79.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited Sri Chamundeshwari Temple, Masjid-e-Azam and St Philomena's Cathedral in Karnataka's Mysuru district on Monday during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Sharing pictures from the three religious sites on social media, Rahul said that religious harmony is the foundation of India's peaceful and progressive future. He began the 26th day of the yatra on Monday.

80.title: Delhi HC asks man to give burgers to orphanages in return for quashing FIR
80.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed a man to provide burgers to two orphanages as a condition for quashing a rape FIR registered against him. Police have been directed to ensure that the burgers are well-made and cooked in a clean environment. Noting that the complainant and the accused were married earlier, the court said the dispute appeared to be matrimonial.

81.title: 2 college students dead, 5 injured as car crashes into shop in Pune
81.article_body: Two MIT College students died and five of their friends were injured after the car they were travelling in crashed into a shop in Pune on Tuesday, police said. "They were going towards Saswad and had plans to see...sunrise, but the person driving the vehicle lost control, leading to the accident," police said. The deceased were aged 18 and 19.

82.title: Amit Shah condoles death of 10 mountaineers in U'khand avalanche
82.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday condoled the loss of lives in an avalanche in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi. "I have spoken to officials in this regard. Local administration, SDRF, NDRF, ITBP and Army teams are engaged in relief and rescue operations with full readiness," Shah added. Ten trainee mountaineers have been killed in the avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak.

83.title: Ajay Devgn's VFX company denies working on 'Adipurush' amid backlash
83.article_body: Trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared a statement by Ajay Devgn's VFX company NY VFXwaala clarifying their involvement in Prabhas-starrer 'Adipurush' amid online backlash over its CGI effects. "Leading VFX studio, NY VFXWalla has clarified...they've not worked/are not working on the CG/special effects of 'Adipurush'," the statement read. The film is directed by Om Raut and also features Kriti Sanon.

84.title: Satellite mapping & geofencing important to detect encroachments: SC
84.article_body: The Supreme Court has said that satellite mapping and geofencing are extremely important considering that unauthorised construction is a perennial problem. "It is necessary that the modern technologies for satellite mapping of lands and buildings to detect encroachments, illegal constructions and geofencing of lands for prompt monitoring take place," said the court.

85.title: President Murmu, actor Prabhas to be chief guests on Dussehra in Delhi
85.article_body: Delhi's famous Lav Kush Ramlila Committee is set to celebrate Dussehra with three chief guests this year. President Droupadi Murmu, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Baahubali actor Prabhas will attend the mega event at the iconic Red Fort ground on Dussehra. A total of nine effigies have been made this year for the grand finale.

86.title: Alcaraz, Nadal make history as world's top two players from Spain
86.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal made history when they became the top two ranked players in the world from Spain on Monday. Following this, world number one Alcaraz said, "Proud to share this historic moment with Nadal, the best player of all time!" With Alcaraz already at world number one, Nadal climbed past Casper Ruud to become world number two.

87.title: Poster outside RJD office showing Opp'n unity portrays Lalu Yadav as Lord Vishnu
87.article_body: A poster outside Rashtriya Janata Dal's (RJD) office in Bihar's Patna showing Opposition unity portrays party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav as an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The poster also portrays Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as Arjun and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav as Shree Krishna. "Strong objection must be taken for insult of our Hindu gods!" said BJP worker Priti Gandhi.

88.title: 4 women chosen to run world's most remote post office & count penguins in Antarctica
88.article_body: Four women have been selected from 6,000 candidates to run the world's most remote post office and count penguins in Antarctica. Clare Ballantyne, Mairi Hilton, Natalie Corbett and Lucy Bruzzone will travel 9,000 miles from the UK to manage the historic site of Port Lockroy, on Goudier Island. They will spend five months without electricity, running water or flushing toilet.

89.title: It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now: Madhuri Dixit
89.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that earlier there were many talented actresses and "so few" good roles for women. "Now that they are being written, they are giving all these artistes a chance to show what they can do with all these roles," she added. "It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now," she added.

90.title: Several French cities to ban Qatar FIFA WC fan zones over humanitarian issues
90.article_body: Several French cities, including Lille, Strasbourg and Bordeaux, have decided to not organise fan zones or put up giant TV screens to show the matches of the upcoming FIFA World Cup. The decision is taken in protest against the alleged ecological and humanitarian abuses in Qatar. Lille Mayor Martine Aubry called the WC "nonsense in terms of human rights".

91.title: The passes are insane, we find each other: Haaland on Kevin De Bruyne
91.article_body: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland, who has now scored 14 goals in eight Premier League games, has opened up on his "chemistry" with their midfielder Kevin De Bruyne, stating that "they find each other" during matches. Haaland added, "It's natural, that I go on the run, and he finds me. When this feels natural, there is nothing better."

92.title: Acting like robot wasn't easy for me: Angad Bedi on 'The List'
92.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi, speaking about playing a robot in the short film 'The List', said, "Acting like robots for me isn't easy." "It's the toughest thing to do and then you have to project certain emotions while you act all robotic," he added. "Working with Kirti (Kulhari) and taking workshops for 5 days helped me a lot," Angad further said.

93.title: Patole made 'cheetah' remark to criticise PM and please Rahul: BJP
93.article_body: Responding to Congress leader Nana Patole's remark that the Centre brought cheetahs to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP's Chandrashekhar Bawankule said that Patole made the remark to criticise PM Narendra Modi and please Rahul Gandhi. "Patole is suffering from some disease...It appears that he is unwell and needs a good doctor," Bawankule said.

94.title: PM Modi wishes citizens on Navami, seeks blessings for everyone
94.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone on the occasion of Navami and sought blessings for all the citizens. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "The Mahanavami of Navratri is dedicated to Mother Siddhidatri. May all of you be inspired to walk on the path of duty as well as achieve success in life. Heartiest congratulations!"

95.title: President Murmu launches 'herSTART', startup platform for women entrepreneurs
95.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu launched 'herSTART', a startup platform of the Gujarat University, in Ahmedabad, for women entrepreneurs on Tuesday. She said that this platform will not only boost innovation and start-up efforts of women entrepreneurs but also prove to be an effective platform in connecting women entrepreneurs with various government and private enterprises.

96.title: 3 more arrested in Arunachal Pradesh paper leak case
96.article_body: Three more people were arrested in connection with the Arunachal Pradesh Public Service Commission Assistant Engineer (Civil) examination question paper leak. With this, the total number of arrests in the case has risen to nine. The state government has recommended a CBI probe into the case. The matter was taken over by the special investigation cell (vigilance) on September 27.

97.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 69-yr-old preacher accused of rape
97.article_body: The Bombay High Court granted pre-arrest bail to a 69-year-old businessman-turned-spiritual preacher from Panvel, who is accused of raping a woman over the past 28 years. The court directed to release the accused on bail on furnishing a personal bond of ₹ 25,000 and surrender his mobile to the investigating officer. The victim lodged her complaint only a month ago.

98.title: Kenya lifts ban on genetically modified crops in response to drought
98.article_body: Kenya on Monday lifted a ban on openly cultivating genetically modified crops, reversing a decade-old decision in response to the worst drought to affect the East African region in 40 years. "Open cultivation and importation of White Maize are now authorised," Kenyan President William Ruto's office said. Authorities are hoping that the move will improve crop yields and food security.

99.title: US, South Korea conduct bombing drills after North Korea fired missile
99.article_body: The US and South Korea conducted bombing drills after North Korea fired a missile over Japan, South Korean military said. It was North Korea's first missile to fly over Japan since 2017 and fifth launch in 10 days. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida called the action "barbaric". The launch prompted warning in northern Japan and residents were urged to take shelter.

100.title: Will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme: Delhi L-G
100.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Tuesday directed the Chief Secretary to inquire into the alleged "irregularities and discrepancies" in the power subsidy given by the AAP government to BSES discoms. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had announced that subsidies will be given on power tariffs to those who opt for it. The LG has sought the report in 7 days.

101.title: 4-yr-old boy attacked by leopard in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
101.article_body: A four-year-old boy was attacked by a leopard on Monday evening in Mumbai's Aarey colony, adjacent to Sanjay Gandhi National Park, forest officials said. The boy, Himanshu Yadav, has been admitted to a hospital with claw injuries on his back, according to an official. The incident allegedly took place when Yadav was going to play garba with his family members.

102.title: K'taka road spray-painted with 'PFI will return' warning, pic surfaces
102.article_body: Days after the government banned Popular Front of India (PFI) and its affiliates, pro-PFI slogans surfaced on a road in Bantwal town of Karnataka's Mangaluru district. Unknown miscreants wrote the slogan 'Beware, PFI will return' in Kannada language on a road in Pilathabettu village on Monday night. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter.

103.title: May you continue to shine with your performances: Uthappa on Pant's birthday
103.article_body: Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa took to Twitter on India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's 25th birthday and wrote, "Happy birthday, champ...May you continue to shine with your performances and entertain us all with your behind the stumps commentary! Lots of love." Pant's teammate Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Happy birthday to my keeper buddy...Have a good one!"

104.title: J&K was ruled by 3 families for 70 yrs, they removed meaning of democracy: Shah
104.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that for 70 years, J&K was ruled by three families and democracy was built only within their families. "Did you ever get the right of Gram Panchayat, Tehsil Panchayat and Zilla Panchayat? Three families had removed the meaning of democracy…only to rule for generations," Shah said during a public rally in Rajouri.

105.title: EU passes law for a single charger for all smartphones from 2024
105.article_body: The European Parliament on Tuesday approved new rules to have a single charging port, USB-C, for all smartphones, tablets and cameras by 2024. The move is expected to affect Apple the most than its rivals, as it will be forced to change its charging port for iPhones. The rule also covers e-readers and earbuds.

106.title: AB de Villiers undergoes eye surgery due to retinal detachment
106.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers revealed during a Twitter Spaces session that he has undergone eye surgery due to retinal detachment. On being asked why he isn't playing Legends League Cricket, De Villiers said, "I'm too old now...I was invited...but I had an eye operation...You might think...I can play with one eye but I'd rather not do that."

107.title: Billionaires Adani, Musk together lose $25 billion in a day as stocks fall: Report
107.article_body: Billionaires Gautam Adani and Elon Musk reportedly lost around $25 billion in a day after the shares of their companies declined on Monday. As per a report, Musk lost $15.5 billion after Tesla's shares recorded the steepest single-day decline of 8.6% in four months, wiping out over $71 billion from its market value. Meanwhile, Adani lost $9.67 billion that day.

108.title: He was as warm as he was 4 yrs ago: Manav on reuniting with co-star Hrithik
108.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil spoke about working with Hrithik Roshan after four years for an ad. The duo worked together in the film 'Super 30'. Manav said, "He is as warm as he was four years ago. We had a brief but good exchange of words. He remembered all the small things that we spoke about during Super 30."

109.title: Baseless claims made to please Rahul: BJP leader on Patole’s 'cheetah' remark
109.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Chandrashekhar Bawankule said it appears that Patole is "unwell and needs a good doctor". "Baseless claims are being made to criticise PM Narendra Modi and to please Rahul Gandhi so that he can save his position," he stated.

110.title: Russia emerges as India's second largest oil supplier in Sept: Report
110.article_body: India's crude oil imports from Russia rose 18.5% month-on-month (MoM) in September, making it the country's second-largest crude oil supplier after Saudi Arabia, The Economic Times reported. The import of 8.79 lakh barrels per day (bpd) of Russian oil in September is India's second highest monthly import ever. India reportedly received first 90,000 tonnes of Russian naphtha last month.

111.title: 'Has 5G been launched to the public?': Paytm CEO to Airtel
111.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday took to Twitter to enquire about Airtel's 5G network availability. He tweeted, "How to activate 5G on an @airtelindia SIM? Has it been launched to the public?" Airtel responded, "We're ready to launch Airtel 5G services from October 2022. By December, we will have coverage in all key metros."

112.title: Russia fines Twitch for not deleting Zelenskyy's advisor's interview: Report
112.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Amazon's Twitch four million roubles ($68,000) for failing to remove an interview with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's advisor, Interfax reported. Russian authorities said the interview violated the country's laws on spread of fake information. Twitch was fined 3 million roubles ($51,000) earlier this year for hosting another interview with the advisor.

113.title: CID officials harass 5-year-old daughter of TDP leader in Hyd: TDP
113.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) has alleged that Andhra Pradesh CID officials in plain clothes barged into TDP leader Chintakayala Vijay's flat when he and his wife weren't at home. Officials questioned Vijay's five-year-old daughter regarding his whereabouts and subjected her to severe emotional harassment, TDP added. The party said officials also took pictures of the girl and her two-year-old sibling.

114.title: Andhra will get special category status if Cong comes to power: Jairam Ramesh
114.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh confirmed that Andhra Pradesh will be given special category status if the party is voted to power in 2024. He said the party would stand by the commitment made to Andhra Pradesh at the time of its bifurcation in 2014. He exuded confidence that the Congress party would come to power at the Centre in 2024.

115.title: Acid served in water bottles in Pak restaurant; manager arrested
115.article_body: Police in Pakistan have arrested a restaurant manager after two minors were served acid in water bottles at a birthday party on September 27. The minors are still undergoing medical treatment at a hospital. The restaurant has been closed until the investigation is completed, police said, adding, "This is a strange incident and we are probing it from all angles."

116.title: Russians request lawyers to help them avoid military mobilisation
116.article_body: Russians have been requesting lawyers and civil society groups for support since President Vladimir Putin announced mobilisation of 300,000 people to fight in Ukraine. Sergei Krivenko, who runs Citizen. Army. Law group, said that "we are working round the clock". "Those coming to us are panicked. They don't understand what is happening. They are calling up anyone," he added.

117.title: She screamed 'Ram', rubbed forehead on my shoe: Arun on woman he met at airport
117.article_body: While speaking about the woman he met at the airport, actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in 'Ramayan', said that the woman saw him and screamed "Ram!". "She then caught my leg and literally rubbed her forehead on my shoe! I didn't know what to do at that point...She told me her husband is in the ICU," he added.

118.title: JP Nadda appoints Dilip Kumar as Sikkim BJP in-charge
118.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda appointed Dilip Kumar as BJP in-charge of Sikkim. Earlier on September 27, Nadda held a meeting with the party's newly appointed state in-charges to chalk out a strategy for the 2024 general elections. "We were told that we need to keep visiting the state and keep highlighting the issues," a source said.

119.title: 10 mountaineers killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand
119.article_body: Ten trainee mountaineers have been killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering Principal Amit Bisht. Eight mountaineers were rescued earlier and a search is on for 11 more. Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "Deeply anguished by the loss of precious lives...My condolences to the bereaved families."

120.title: Ex-Maha Minister Anil Deshmukh gets bail in ED case; to remain in jail
120.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted bail to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The court granted the bail on a surety amount of ₹1 lakh. However, Deshmukh will remain in jail in connection with a case registered by the CBI.

121.title: Don't understand why Rahul, Kohli are being rested for 3rd SA T20I: Ganesh
121.article_body: Amid reports of Virat Kohli and KL Rahul being rested for the third and final T20I against South Africa, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said he doesn't understand the move as both players "had only returned recently". He wrote, "Rahul had only got his rhythm back...When you're in form play as many games as possible...That's what I believe."

122.title: Delhi's Gurdwara Bangla Sahib to get cardiology unit by November
122.article_body: Gurdwara Bangla Sahib will have a cardiology unit at its low-cost dispensary for underprivileged people by November, said Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC). "Around 400-500 heart patients will be provided free consultation services daily in the cardiology unit," said DSGMC chief Harmeet Singh Kalka. Equipment such as ECG machine and oxygen concentrator are being set up, he added.

123.title: Rest of India beat Saurashtra by 8 wickets to win Irani Cup
123.article_body: Rest of India defeated 2019-20 Ranji Trophy champion Saurashtra to win their 29th Irani Cup on Tuesday. In the game, pacer Kuldeep Sen picked a match haul of eight wickets and batter Sarfaraz Khan slammed his 10th first-class hundred as Hanuma Vihari-led Rest of India secured an eight-wicket win over Unadkat-led side. Saurashtra scored 98 and 380 in their innings.

124.title: 5G not working on iPhones yet because Apple has to open it: Airtel CTO
124.article_body: Airtel CTO Randeep Sekhon has said that 5G on iPhones is not working yet because Apple has to open it. "They are promising to open it soon," he added. Sekhon said that Airtel won't be sending an over-the-air update to make 5G work on smartphones. Instead, the mobile handset manufacturer needs to push out the software update to enable 5G.

125.title: Maha govt to set up 700 health clinics named after Bal Thackeray
125.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said the government will set up 700 "Aapla Davakhana" or health clinics in the state named after Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray. "The purpose behind...Aapla Davakhana initiative is to provide medical facilities to people close to their homes," Shinde said in a statement. Mumbai alone will have 227 such facilities, the statement added.

126.title: 'Modi' chants answer those who said Art 370 abrogation will bring bloodbath: Shah
126.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday addressed a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, where he was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi'. "Today's rally and your 'Modi-Modi' chants are answers to those who said if Article 370 will be abrogated, there'll be a bloodbath," Shah said during the rally. Notably, he's on a three-day visit to J&K.

127.title: 3 of family die by suicide in K'taka fearing daughter eloped with Dalit man
127.article_body: A man, along with his wife and son, allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur fearing his 28-year-old daughter had eloped with a Dalit man, police said. The man had filed a complaint on Monday alleging that his daughter had gone missing. The woman has been in a relationship with the youth for the last three years, police added.

128.title: Mumbai metro body plans to earn ₹1,500 cr from non-fare revenue options
128.article_body: The Maha Mumbai Metro Operation Corporation Limited (MMMOCL), which is the operation and maintenance body of Mumbai metro, is planning to raise ₹1,500 crore by giving out commercial rights of metro lines 2A and 7 for next 15 years. The non-fare revenue options through which the metro body plans to generate earnings include advertising rights, food and beverage etc.

129.title: BMC to install bio-toilets in 6 wards of Mumbai soon
129.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install bio-toilets at four locations each in the selected six wards of Mumbai. The BMC had earlier started a similar project but the toilets did not work for long due to poor maintenance. "There's a pit which is...part of installation and doesn't require much digging or other infra," a BMC official said.

130.title: We'll do our best to bring Oscar to India: 'Chhello Show' producer
130.article_body: 'Chhello Show' producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said the team is "honoured and privileged" to be representing India at Oscars 2023, and they will try their best "to bring glory to the country". Commenting on claims that 'Chhello Show' is a copy of 'Cinema Paradiso', Kapur said, "It is a free country and everyone is entitled to an opinion."

131.title: Russian scientist charged with treason dies aged 81 under house arrest
131.article_body: Russian scientist Valery Mitko has died aged 81 while under house arrest on charges of treason. Mitko, a widely-acclaimed researcher of the Arctic region and one of the country's leading hydroacoustics experts, died on Sunday. Mitko was accused of passing state secrets to China during a visit in 2018. He'd remained under house arrest since being detained in February 2020.

132.title: 'Ordinary' Chinese vase sells for ₹61 crore at an auction after bidding war
132.article_body: An "ordinary" Chinese vase that was put up for auction in France was sold for $7.5 million (over ₹61 crore), nearly 4,000 times its estimated value. Around 30 people engaged in a fierce bidding war for the vase, which many believe is a rare artefact from the 18th century. "It's a crazy story," auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat said on the bidding.

133.title: FIR ordered against woman over video of dance on 'Munni Badnaam Hui' at MP temple
133.article_body: An FIR would be registered against a woman for shooting a dance video to the tune of 'Munni Badnaam Hui' on the premises of a temple in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district and posting it on Instagram. "The way Neha dressed and shot the video was objectionable," MP's Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. However, Neha later deleted the video and apologised.

134.title: Never expected big leaders' support but need everyone's backing: Tharoor
134.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he never expected big leaders to support him for the party's President post, but he needs everyone's backing. Tharoor's remark came after Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran declared his support for Mallikarjun Kharge for the post. On Sudhakaran's support to Kharge, Tharoor said, "I don't need to decipher what's going...in people's minds."

135.title: US to send more weapons to Ukraine in $625 million aid package
135.article_body: The Biden administration is likely to include four High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) launchers, munitions, mines and mine-resistant vehicles in its $625 million package to Ukraine, Reuters reported. The package will be made available to Ukraine under Presidential Drawdown Authority. Through this, US will be able to transfer weapons quickly without congressional approval.

136.title: Ecuador prison gang fight leaves 15 dead, 20 injured
136.article_body: A clash between inmates in a prison in Ecuador's Latacunga on Monday has left at least 15 inmates dead and 20 injured, authorities said. Ecuador's SNAI prison agency said prisoners had fought with guns and knives before guards managed to regain control. Officials attributed the prison violence to fights between gangs over control of territory and drug trafficking routes.

137.title: Nobel Prize in Physics awarded to Aspect, Clauser and Zeilinger for work in quantum mechanics
137.article_body: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has decided to award the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physics to Alain Aspect, John F Clauser and Anton Zeilinger, according to an official tweet. They have been awarded the Nobel Prize for experiments with entangled photons, establishing the violation of Bell inequalities and pioneering quantum information science.

138.title: I'm confused by reactions to 'Vikram...', but I'm satisfied: Hrithik
138.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan said he is confused by the reactions to his recently-released film 'Vikram Vedha'. "I'm very satisfied with the film...We had fun making it, I learnt a lot. I'm happy with the final film," Hrithik added. Hrithik stated the world is saying a lot of things about his film, which is mostly positive and he's "slowly absorbing it".

139.title: If Aus Women captaincy comes my way, I won’t turn it down: Alyssa Healy
139.article_body: With Australia Women captain Meg Lanning on an indefinite break from cricket, opener Alyssa Healy has said if captaincy comes her way, she won't turn it down. "I'd really take the challenge and hopefully leave a mark on the game," added Healy. Lanning-led Australia won the 2022 ODI WC and the gold medal in the first-ever Commonwealth Games cricket competition.

140.title: Man from Liberia held for smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 cr at Delhi airport
140.article_body: A man from Liberia was arrested for smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 crore into India at Indira Gandhi International Airport. "The passenger accepted he ingested/swallowed some capsules. The medical procedure yielded the recovery of 50 capsules which further resulted in the recovery of a total of 599 grams of a white powdery substance," a statement issued by customs officials stated.

141.title: Sushmita Sen to play a transgender in her next web series: Reports
141.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen will reportedly play the role of a transgender woman in her forthcoming web series, which is being directed by Marathi filmmaker Ravi Jadhav. As per reports, the six-episode show is based on the life of prominent transgender activist Gauri Sawant. Sushmita is expected to wrap up the series by the end of November, reports said.

142.title: Was at a point of quitting filmmaking: 'Black Panther' director on Boseman's death
142.article_body: 'Black Panther' director Ryan Coogler said he considered quitting filmmaking after actor Chadwick Boseman's death in August 2020. "I was at a point when I was like, 'I'm walking away from this business'," Coogler said. He added that he didn't know if he could make another 'Black Panther' film as the passing of Chadwick Boseman had hurt him a lot.

143.title: Cleanliness, safety should be top priorities during festivities: UP CM
143.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that cleanliness, safety and compassion should be top priorities during festivities. He extended his wishes to the people of the state on the occasion of Maha Navami and Dussehra. Safety measures are being given the utmost importance at all the Durga Puja pandals and temples during the festivities by the administration, he stated.

144.title: 6 people drown in Tamil Nadu's  Kollidam river
144.article_body: Six people died after drowning in the Kollidam river near Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur district, said police. They were among 52 pilgrims who arrived at the Poondi Madha Basilica from Thoothukudi. The incident occurred when the victims entered the river to take bath before visiting the church. Five bodies were found on Monday and one on Tuesday, said police.

145.title: Bengaluru civic body to restart demolition drive from October 6
145.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will be resuming the anti-encroachment demolition drive in the city after Dussehra holidays (October 6), the civic authority officials said. The statement comes after the Karnataka High Court warned  BBMP that it will hold back salary of its engineers who are responsible for the demolition drives if the encroachment removal is delayed.

146.title: I don't think so: Finch on inclusion of Cameron Green in WC squad
146.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that he doesn't "think" that all-rounder Cameron Green will be included in the already announced squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "He (green) had a really good tour of India. It was good for him to get an opportunity to open the batting," Finch said. Green scored 118 runs in three games against India.

147.title: B'luru hotel staffer peeps into bathroom as woman takes bath, arrested
147.article_body: A hotel housekeeper in Bengaluru's Bellandur has been arrested for peeping into the bathroom of a woman guest who was taking shower. The 22-year-old victim, who was staying at the hotel with her parents, said she saw someone peeping from the ventilator of the bathroom. Confessing to the crime, Pawalus Kheria said he hadn't recorded any video of the woman.

148.title: Will give reservation to Gujjar, Bakarwal and Pahari communities in J&K: Amit Shah
148.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the Centre would implement reservations for the Gujjar, Bakarwal and Pahari communities in Jammu and Kashmir. Shah also said minorities and Dalits living in the Union Territory would not have gotten reservation rights if abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A would not have been done.

149.title: Suryakumar's form is essential for India's chances of winning WC: Saba
149.article_body: Former cricketer Saba Karim said that India's chances of winning the upcoming T20 World Cup depend largely on batter Suryakumar Yadav's form. "I say this because he plays in such a difficult position," Saba said. He added, "He's got an uncanny ability to find the gaps in the right areas [and] at times he toys with the bowling."

150.title: Noida, Greater Noida gear up for 3 new Metro corridors to boost connectivity
150.article_body: The Noida and Greater Noida authorities are gearing up to extend metro rail connectivity as the process of directly connecting the Aqua Line with the Blue Line from Greater Noida to Delhi has been initiated. According to HT, the authorities are working on three new metro corridors. One of the extensions is from Sector 51 to Knowledge Park-V Metro Station.

151.title: Hyd taxi drivers seek action against unauthorised private operators
151.article_body: An association of Telangana taxi drivers has urged authorities to stop unauthorised private operators from setting up illegal pick-up points on the outskirts of Hyderabad during Dussehra festival. "This not only affects the business of taxis and cabs and the state's revenue, but also there is no accountability for the safety of the passengers," the chairman of the group said.

152.title: NGT imposes ₹3,825 cr penalty on T'gana for poor urban waste management
152.article_body: National Green Tribunal imposed a penalty of ₹3,825 crore on the Telangana government for poor urban waste management. "Suitable mechanism be laid down in two months such as user charges by households/contribution of corporate, business sectors, commercial establishments who contribute to waste," NGT said. The statutory timelines for remediation of legacy waste expired in April 2021, it stated.

153.title: Speedy recovery to our speedster: BCCI to Bumrah on being ruled out of T20 WC
153.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah's tweet after the India pacer was ruled out of T20 World Cup due to a back injury, BCCI said, "Speedy recovery to our speedster." Bumrah wrote on Twitter, "I'm gutted that I won't be a part of the T20 World Cup this time...As I recover, I'll be cheering on the team through their campaign in Australia."

154.title: Ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav’s health condition still critical, say doctors
154.article_body: Former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav’s health condition is still critical, doctors said on Tuesday. "Mulayam Singh is…admitted to Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of Medanta Hospital, Gurugram and is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists," an official statement read. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks.

155.title: 'Dear death, come into my life,' read diary of J&K DG Prisons' alleged killer
155.article_body: The personal diary of the man, who allegedly killed J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia, reveals a depressed mind fixated on death, said reports quoting police. "Dear death, come into my life...I'm having a bad day, week, month, year, life," a note read. Other pages are filled with notes including "I hate my life" and "Life is just grief", reports added.

156.title: 'OMG: Oh...' would've faced problems if it had released today: Govvind
156.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has said that his 2012 film 'OMG: Oh My God!' would have faced many problems if it had been released now. He added, "I see it positively. I'm not saying those the protestors are wrong in objecting." The film also featured Akshay Kumar and Paresh Rawal. Govvind said he signed the film as the script was balanced.

157.title: VLC media player operator sends legal notice to Indian govt over website ban
157.article_body: VideoLAN, a non-profit that operates VLC media player, has sent a legal notice to IT Ministry and Department of Telecommunications months after its website with the link to download VLC was blocked by the government. In the notice, VideoLAN demanded a copy of blocking order issued for banning the URL and an opportunity to defend its case through a hearing.

158.title: T'gana Minister fined ₹15,000 by Hyd civic body for illegal hoarding
158.article_body: Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav has been fined ₹15,000 by the Hyderabad civic body for erecting an unauthorised hoarding at Tank Bund Road. The civic body also fined Congress leader Anil Kumar Yadav ₹10,000 for putting up an illegal hoarding in Narayanguda. The fine was imposed by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's Directorate of Enforcement Vigilance and Disaster Management.

159.title: 4th accused in murder of 25-yr-old in Delhi's Sunder Nagri arrested
159.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested the fourth accused in connection with the murder of a 25-year-old Manish in the Sunder Nagri area of North East Delhi on October 1. Earlier, the police arrested three suspects in the matter. A purported video of the incident went viral on social media which showed the bystanders watching as the accused stabbed Manish several times.

160.title: US Prez Biden visits Hurricane Fiona-hit Puerto Rico, pledges help
160.article_body: US President Joe Biden visited Puerto Rico two weeks after Hurricane Fiona had hit the Caribbean island and promised to "rebuild it all". During the visit, Biden announced the allocation of $60 million in new funding through Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. At least 25 people were killed and more than 137,000 were left without power because of Hurricane Fiona.

161.title: US calls North Korea launch 'dangerous'; pledges to defend allies
161.article_body: The US condemned North Korea's "dangerous and reckless" missile launch over Japan. US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan held calls with his counterparts in South Korea and Japan to discuss "appropriate and robust joint and international responses" over the launch, the White House said. During the calls, Sullivan reinforced the "ironclad" US commitments to the defence of both countries.

162.title: Viral video shows Kanye, models walking in mud pit for Balenciaga; Twitter users react
162.article_body: Models walked in a muddy pit to display luxury fashion brand Balenciaga's spring/summer 2023 collection at Paris Fashion Week recently. Rapper Kanye West made his modelling debut as he opened for Balenciaga. "I know it smells crazy in there," a Twitter user reacted to a video of the show. "Social experiment gone wrong," said another user.

163.title: India exports iPhones worth $1 billion in 5 months: Report
163.article_body: The value of iPhones exported from India crossed $1 billion from April to August, Bloomberg reported citing sources. The shipments from India, mainly to Europe and the Middle East, are expected to hit $2.5 billion in the 12 months through March 2023. About three million iPhones were made in India last year, compared with 230 million in China.

164.title: Centre didn’t sanction single medical college in T’gana: State Health Minister
164.article_body: Telangana Health Minister T Harish Rao said while 157 medical colleges have been sanctioned in the country by the Centre, not a single college has been sanctioned in Telangana. "Today, if the number of medical seats and medical colleges has increased, it was possible because the CM has allocated more funds for the medical sector in the budget," Rao added.

165.title: 1 dead, 5 injured after cooking gas cylinder explodes inside home in UP
165.article_body: A 30-year-old man was killed while five people of a family were injured after a cooking gas cylinder exploded inside their house in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The injured include two women and a child. Reports said that police officials rushed to the spot after receiving the information about the incident and rescued the victims.

166.title: Meta closing one of its New York offices amid cost-cutting measures: Report
166.article_body: Meta is reportedly closing one of its New York offices amid its plans to scale down its expansion in the city. The lease for 225 Park Avenue South office in Manhattan has reportedly been terminated. A Meta spokesperson said the move is aimed at making "focused investments". Earlier, Meta said it will freeze hiring and restructure teams to cut expenses.

167.title: 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' has nothing to do with the old film: Zafar
167.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar shared that his film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' "has nothing to do with the old film", which starred Govinda and Amitabh Bachchan. However, he mentioned that his film has a "very interesting twist", which may act as an ode to the 1998 release. Zafar's 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' will star Tiger Shroff and Akshay Kumar.

168.title: Sorry, I'm done: Moeen Ali on potential Test return for England
168.article_body: On the possibility of him returning to Tests, England all-rounder Moeen Ali said he has had an "honest" talk with their Test coach Brendon McCullum and it's "time to close the door on that side" of his career. He added, "Baz phoned me, we spoke at length and I said, 'Sorry, I'm done'." Moeen retired from Tests in September 2021.

169.title: 28 mountaineers trapped on Uttarakhand's Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak after avalanche
169.article_body: As many as 28 trainees of Nehru Institute of Mountaineering are reported to be trapped after an avalanche hit Draupadi Ka Danda-2 mountain peak in Uttarakhand, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday. Rapid relief operations are presently underway to rescue those trapped, the CM added. The peak is located in the Gangotri range of the Garhwal Himalayas in Uttarakhand.

170.title: PFI was engaged in conspiracies: Maharashtra Dy CM Devendra Fadnavis
170.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis praised the Centre for banning the Popular Front of India (PFI) and said that the organisation was engaged in conspiracies. "The ban on PFI is absolutely correct. If Naxalites are helping PFI, then Naxalites will only help their supporters...Those who are against democracy, such elements can enter anywhere and spread chaos," said Fadnavis.

171.title: Dengue cases rise in Gurugram, maximum cases from Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar
171.article_body: Gurugram witnessed an increase in dengue cases as the number of cases doubled in the past eight days. According to district health department's data, Gurugram reported 241 dengue cases this year so far, out of which 116 cases were reported since last Monday. The maximum cases have been reported from Farrukhnagar and Wazirabad, with the areas accounting for 184 cases.

172.title: Temple decorated with ₹8-cr currency notes on walls & floor, gold in Andhra; pics viral
172.article_body: A 135-year-old temple of Goddess Vasavi Kanyaka Parameswari was decorated with currency notes and gold ornaments worth ₹8 crore for Navratri. Pictures of the temple showed currency notes on walls and floor and hanging from trees. "It's public contribution and will be returned once the puja is over. It won't go to temple trust," the temple committee said.

173.title: Rajnath Singh to celebrate Dussehra with soldiers in Uttarakhand
173.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is on a two-day visit to Uttarakhand to celebrate the festival of Vijayadashami with soldiers in Auli and Mana. According to sources, he will participate in an army event today and will have 'Bada Khana' with soldiers. He will also offer prayers at the Badrinath temple and celebrate Dussehra with jawans tomorrow.

174.title: It's not rocket science to understand Prashant Kishor's script: Manoj Jha
174.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Jha criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor over his "nothing has changed in Bihar" remark and said that it's not rocket science to understand Kishor's script.
