"To understand Bihar, you need to analyse it first...When Jharkhand was separated, what did Bihar get after that? The foundation of our industry was strong because of Jharkhand," added Jha.

175.title: Didn't imagine family would be destroyed: Husband of woman killed in UP fire
175.article_body: Rampati Gautam, the husband of Jai Devi who died in fire that broke out at a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, said he never imagined that his family would be destroyed in one day. Devi and her two grandsons died in the fire. Gautam said that it was his biggest mistake to let them go to the pandal.

176.title: Bajrang Dal workers clash with bouncers at garba event in Surat
176.article_body: Bajrang Dal workers clashed with bouncers at a garba event in Gujarat's Surat on Monday after finding out they belonged to the Muslim community. One bouncer was reportedly injured in the incident. "If any organiser has hired Muslim security bouncers and Bajrang Dal workers come to know about it, such clashes will happen," said Hitendrasinh Rajput, spokesperson of Bajrang Dal.

177.title: Amenities shut in Delhi's Air India Colony, residents say pressure to vacate
177.article_body: Basic amenities have been suspended in the Air India (AI) Colony in New Delhi's Vasant Vihar, reports said. The residents of the society are reportedly alleging that this has been done to pressurise them to vacate their homes. "Security and other...staff is also being withdrawn and it appears...indirect restrictions are being imposed on those still living here," a resident said.

178.title: Sweden sends diving vessel to probe gas leaks at Nord Stream pipelines
178.article_body: Sweden has sent a diving vessel to investigate the area of the Nord Stream pipelines in the Baltic Sea, where blasts triggered gas leakages. In a press release, Sweden's prosecution authority designated the area as a crime scene. European Council President Charles Michel has called the incident an act of sabotage. Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed US for the incident.

179.title: Himachal police recalls order seeking 'character certificates' of journalists for PM's events
179.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Police on Tuesday withdrew its earlier order that demanded a 'character certification' of journalists covering PM Narendra Modi’s visit to the state on Wednesday. The new notification read, "It is regretted that the...letter was inadvertently issued by this office. The...letter stands withdrawn. We welcome all the press correspondents…we’ll facilitate their coverage."

180.title: 'Brahmastra' earns ₹425 crore worldwide in 25 days
180.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji shared that his latest film 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' has earned ₹425 crore worldwide in 25 days of its release. Sharing the news on Instagram, Ayan thanked the audience and expressed his gratitude for making the film the "no. 1 worldwide Hindi movie of 2022". The film featured Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in the lead role.

181.title: Info Edge invests ₹135.4 crore in edtech startup Coding Ninjas
181.article_body: Info Edge has invested ₹135.4 crore in edtech startup Coding Ninjas and has increased its stake in the company from 26% to 51%. Coding Ninjas' approximate valuation is now at ₹541 crore. The startup was co-founded by Ankush Singla, Kannu Mittal and Dhawal Parate in 2016. In 2020, it raised ₹37.10 crore from Info Edge in Series A funding round.

182.title: Bird flu discovered at Dutch farm; over 1 lakh chickens to be culled
182.article_body: The Netherlands on Tuesday said that it will cull around 1,02,000 chickens after authorities detected an outbreak of the highly pathogenic bird flu virus on a farm. A total of 15 cases of the highly lethal form of avian flu have been reported in the Netherlands in the past month, following dozens of cases earlier in the year.

183.title: 5 killed after car collides with MSRTC bus in Maharashtra's Latur
183.article_body: As many as five people, including two women, were killed after their car overturned following a collision with a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus in Latur on Tuesday morning, said police. The victims were travelling to Nanded after visiting a temple at Tuljapur when the incident occurred. A sixth passenger was undergoing treatment, said police.

184.title: Sanjay Raut's judicial custody extended till Oct 10 in Patra Chawl case
184.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's judicial custody has been extended till October 10 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. He played a major role in laundering money in the Patra Chawl scam, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) earlier told a special PMLA court. Raut was arrested by ED on August 1 in the ₹1,034-crore land scam case.

185.title: Traffic restrictions in Mumbai's Shivaji Park area, Bandra for Dussehra rallies
185.article_body: The Mumbai Police have announced traffic restrictions near Mumbai's Shivaji Park and Bandra area on October 5 in view of Dussehra rallies which will be held by two Shiv Sena factions. The CM Eknath Shinde faction will be hosting the rally at MMRDA ground in BKC while the Uddhav Thackeray faction will hold their rally at Shivaji Park in Dadar.

186.title: Going to auction Sridevi's sarees from 'English Vinglish': Gauri Shinde
186.article_body: Director Gauri Shinde said to celebrate 10 years of her 2012 directorial 'English Vinglish', the makers will be auctioning the sarees Sridevi wore as Shashi in the film. "I would like to use it for girls' education NGO. I always wanted to do this, but it never happened. I thought now, this would be the most befitting," she said.

187.title: 500 Mail Express trains speeded up in Railways’ new timetable
187.article_body: In the Railways’ new timetable, around 500 Mail Express trains have been speeded up, Railway Ministry said while adding that the trains will now reach their destinations 10-70 minutes faster. Overall, the average speed of all trains has increased by about 5% leading to availability of nearly 5% additional paths for operation of more trains, the ministry stated.

188.title: Wishing you a career as 'lamba & ghana as your zulfein': Yuvraj on Pant's 25th b'day
188.article_body: Wishing India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on his 25th birthday, ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Wishing you a career as 'lamba and ghana as your zulfein'." He added, "Stay blessed Rishabh...God bless and all the best for the World Cup. Happy birthday!" Former cricketer Suresh Raina also wished Pant, tweeting, "May you continue to make the whole team and nation proud."

189.title: US chipmaker NVIDIA ceases operations in Russia amid Ukraine war
189.article_body: As Russian invasion of Ukraine continues, US-based chipmaker NVIDIA has said it is ceasing all operations in Russia. The company will give its employees in Russia the option of continuing work in other countries. The chipmaker said it had maintained its office in Russia to support employees and their families but can no longer operate in light of recent developments.

190.title: Kia India recalls over 44,000 units of Carens to inspect airbag control software
190.article_body: Kia India has recalled 44,174 units of its latest model Carens in order to inspect and fix any potential error in the airbag control software module. The company also said that if any error is found during the inspection, a software update will be provided free of cost. Kia Carens was launched in India in February 2022.

191.title: Brave & poignant dramedy: Karan Johar on Madhuri Dixit's 'Maja Ma'
191.article_body: Director Karan Johar said Madhuri Dixit's film 'Maja Ma' is a "brave, poignant and to add, an audience pleaser" dramedy that hits the spot with its "relentless storytelling". He said he wants a spin-off of Sheeba Chadha and Rajit Kapur's characters in the film, who he found "howlarious". He added that Madhuri is "a pleasure to watch in every frame".

192.title: Southwest monsoon likely to withdraw from Pune by October 7: IMD
192.article_body: The southwest monsoon is likely to withdraw from Pune by October 7, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Till October 5, chances of rainfall in Pune city are less...if rains occur it'll be a very short spell in afternoon/evening time," an official added. "But from October 5 evening onwards, marginally rain chances are likely to increase...till October 6," the official stated.

193.title: Russian rapper dies by suicide to avoid serving in war, said 'not ready to kill' in video
193.article_body: Russian rapper Ivan Vitalievich Petunin, also known as 'Walkie', jumped to his death after being drafted to fight in the war against Ukraine. In his last video, the 27-year-old said that he was "not ready to kill for any ideals". His body was found on the connecting Congressnaya Street in Krasnodar city.

194.title: 2 girls set ablaze by their father die in Thane hospital
194.article_body: A 14-year-old girl and her 11-year-old sister, who were allegedly burnt alive by their father, died while undergoing treatment at a hospital in Thane, the police said. Their mother also died of burn wounds on Sunday. On investigation, the police found that the accused man was having an affair with another woman and was harassing his wife and daughters.

195.title: Prime accused in murder of J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia caught
195.article_body: The prime accused, 23-year-old Yasir Ahmed, in the murder of Jammu and Kashmir's Director General (Prisons) Hemant Lohia was apprehended on Tuesday after a major manhunt by J&K Police throughout the night. Police said Ahmed was working at Lohia's house for nearly six months and was reportedly quite aggressive in his behaviour and was also under depression.

196.title: Green can only come into Aus' WC squad if someone gets injured: Watson
196.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said batter Cameron Green can only be included in Australia's T20 World Cup squad if someone gets ruled out of the marquee tournament. "Green is certainly good...but I'd definitely give the players, who did a great job in last year's World Cup, the first opportunity," explained Watson. Green scored 118 runs in recently-concluded India T20Is.

197.title: Indonesia police chief removed after 125 die in football match stampede
197.article_body: An Indonesian police chief and nine elite officers have been removed from their posts after at least 125 people were killed in a stampede at a football match in Indonesia. The stampede reportedly happened after police fired tear gas to disperse Arema FC fans, who'd poured onto the pitch after their first home defeat to Persebaya Surabaya in 23 years.

198.title: I now work as labourer for ₹300 per day: B.Tech grad as Wipro delays onboarding
198.article_body: A B.Tech graduate said he's working as a daily-wage labourer at a construction site for ₹300 per day after Wipro delayed the onboarding of freshers. "[My family is] questioning if the job ever existed," he told Moneycontrol. "I had two more offer letters...I dropped those," another graduate, who received an offer letter from Wipro but hasn't been onboarded yet, said.

199.title: Tiger kills 10 cows in Kerala; drones deployed, cages installed in area
199.article_body: After a tiger was reported to have killed 10 cows in Kerala's Munnar, drones have now been deployed to track it, reports said. Reports added that cages have also been installed in the area and night vision cameras have been made functional. Officials said that the suspicion is that the mother was training her cubs when the cows were attacked.

200.title: MP minister asks to cut offensive scenes in Adipurush, says 'Lord Hanuman shown in leather'
200.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said that there are "objectionable scenes" in the 'Adipurush' trailer. He said, "Lord Hanuman is shown wearing clothes of leather. Such scenes hurt religious sentiments." He added, "I am writing to producer Om Raut to remove such scenes. If he doesn't remove, we'll think about legal action."

201.title: Doctor arrested for raping woman with 2 colleagues in UP's Basti
201.article_body: A doctor who allegedly befriended a woman on social media and then raped her in Uttar Pradesh's Basti has been arrested, police said on Tuesday. According to the victim, the accused took her to his hostel room where he, along with two other doctors, raped her. A case was filed under IPC Sections 376-D, 504 and 506.

202.title: One-way airline tickets from Russia up 27% from Sept 21-27: Report
202.article_body: The number of issued one-way tickets from Russia increased 27% the week President Vladimir Putin announced military mobilisation, ForwardKeys' flight ticketing data showed. Sixty percent tickets bought from Sept 21-27 had a departure date within 15 days, up from 45% the previous week. There was a triple-digit rise in one-way tickets from Russia to Tbilisi, Almaty and Dubai among others.

203.title: People wanted it for a long time: Reynolds on Wolverine in 'Deadpool 3'
203.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds said he feels "excited" about Hugh Jackman's Wolverine "coming back for another ride" in 'Deadpool 3' and added that it's "something that people have wanted for a long time". Talking about working with Hugh Jackman, Reynolds said he "couldn't be more excited" to be sharing screen space with one of his "closest friends" in the entertainment business.

204.title: 46 new EV charging points installed at Bengaluru's Nexus Shantiniketan Mall
204.article_body: A total of 46 new electric vehicle charging points have been installed at Bengaluru's Nexus Shantiniketan Mall by a Finland-based energy firm Fortum. The charging points include both AC chargers and even Combined Charging System (CCS) chargers. In April, Fortum had installed 50 EV charging points at this mall and decided to increase the points after it received good response.

205.title: 8 students get life sentence for raping minor girl in UP's Jhansi
205.article_body: Eight students of a polytechnic college in Jhansi have been sentenced to life imprisonment by a special POCSO court for raping a minor girl in 2020. The victim was going to tuition with her friend when the perpetrators dragged them inside a hostel. A policeman, who was passing by, heard the girl screaming and rescued her.

206.title: Twitter's edit button goes live for Twitter Blue members in selected regions
206.article_body: After posting its first-ever edited tweet, Twitter on Monday through its Twitter Blue account announced that the 'Edit Tweet' option has been launched for Blue subscribers in Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Twitter Blue users can now edit a posted tweet five times for up to 30 minutes and the history of the edits will also display under the tweet.

207.title: Man falls from 11th floor as doors open without lift car in Raj, dies
207.article_body: A 20-year-old man died after he fell into a lift shaft from the 11th floor of an apartment building in Rajasthan. The lift car reportedly did not come up but the lift doors opened when he pressed the button for the lift. The man was rushed to hospital and died during treatment. His body was handed over to his family.

208.title: 2 farmers hit each other with spades over ₹5 lakh dispute in UP, both die
208.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad Police said two farmers died after they hit each other with spades over a ₹5 lakh dispute in Duhai. "When police reached the spot, one of them had already succumbed to his injuries, while the other was still breathing...he died during treatment," police added. "The two were found lying on a field soaked in blood," police stated.

209.title: Denmark's Queen says 'sorry' for stripping royal titles from grandchildren
209.article_body: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II has apologised after stripping four of her grandchildren of their royal titles but didn't reverse the move. Queen Margrethe said her decision had been "a long time coming" and was an attempt to modernise Denmark's monarchy. She'd announced last week that her younger son Prince Joachim's children will no longer be called Prince/Princess from next year.

210.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's ex-husband Athar Aamir Khan gets married to Dr Mehreen Qazi
210.article_body: IAS 2015 rank 2 Athar Aamir Khan, who got divorced with IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi last year, recently got married to Dr Mehreen Qazi. Khan, who's currently posted as Srinagar Municipal Corporation (SMC) Commissioner, also shared a video of their wedding ceremony on social media. Tina got married to 2013-batch IAS officer Pradeep Gawande in April this year.

211.title: Vice President Dhankhar interacts with floor leaders of Rajya Sabha
211.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday interacted with floor leaders of Rajya Sabha at the Upa-Rashtrapati Nivas. Dhankhar, who took over as the Vice President on August 11, is also the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. Leader of the House in Rajya Sabha Piyush Goyal, Congress' Shaktisinh Gohil and Samajwadi Party's Ram Gopal Yadav were among those present.

212.title: Commendable: PM Modi on sculpture made with plastic bottles at Bengaluru station
212.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to praise the efforts of staffers at Bengaluru's KSR railway station who created a demon-shaped sculpture using plastic bottles littered around. "Such efforts are not only innovative and commendable but most importantly remind us of our basic civic duty of keeping our surroundings and public places clean," tweeted PM Modi.

213.title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Vaishno Devi temple during J&K visit
213.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at Vaishno Devi temple in Katra on Tuesday morning. Shah's visit coincides with the ninth day of the ongoing Navratri festival. He was accompanied by J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Union Minister Jitendra Singh. Shah is on a visit to J&K and is scheduled to address a public meeting at Rajouri today.

214.title: I am gutted: Jasprit Bumrah on missing T20 World Cup 2022
214.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to back injury, penned a note on Instagram. He wrote, "I'm gutted...I won’t be a part of...T20 World Cup...but thankful for the wishes, care and support I’ve received from my loved ones. As I recover...I’ll be cheering on the team through their campaign in Australia."

215.title: Snake was also enjoying match, wanted a closer look: ACA Secretary Saikia
215.article_body: Talking about the interruption caused due to a snake entering the field during India's second T20I against South Africa in Guwahati, Assam Cricket Association (ACA) Secretary Devajit Saikia said sometimes intruders disrupt proceedings in matches. "Here we had a different thing, a snake. I'm sure the snake was also enjoying the match and wanted a close look," he jokingly added.

216.title: After fire at Bhadohi pandal, police review safety at Noida venues
216.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and the fire department officials reviewed security and fire safety arrangements at Ramlila fairs and Durga Puja pandals in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad on Monday. The action comes after five people were killed and over 60 injured in a fire at a Durga Puja pandal in UP's Bhadohi on Sunday night.

217.title: He is an understated actor: R Balki on Abhishek Bachchan
217.article_body: Director R Balki called Abhishek Bachchan an "understated actor" with a "certain casualness behind his simmering intensity". Balki said Abhishek is "no longer weighed down" by the pressure of the project, adding that he has "learnt to relax for the camera, without losing the punch in his performance". Abhishek will be seen in Balki's upcoming film 'Ghoomer'.

218.title: The Kapil Sharma Show to pay tribute to late comedian Raju Srivastava
218.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' will host some of the popular comedians in its upcoming episode to pay tribute to the late comedian Raju Srivastava. Comedians such as Jayvijay Sachan, Sunil Pal, Rajiv Thakur, Vijay Ishwarlal Pawar, and others will grace the special episode. Raju Srivastava passed away on September 21 at the age of 58.

219.title: Consider myself fortunate to be a part of 'Adipurush': Kriti Sanon
219.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said she considers herself fortunate to have gotten the chance to be a part of 'Adipurush' and play the role of Janaki aka Sita in the Om Raut directorial. "It's been a dream experience. I just hope I don't disappoint you all. I hope you like me," she said. 'Adipurush' also stars Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan.

220.title: Case filed against Hindu group for showing Mahatma Gandhi as asura in Kolkata
220.article_body: The Kolkata Police have filed a case against Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha for placing an idol of Mahatma Gandhi instead of the asura at the feet of the Durga idol at a community puja. "By the time the police came and replaced Gandhi's idol with that of the asura, our mission was complete," said Hindu Mahasabha's state working President.

221.title: Mobile data services suspended in Jammu, Rajouri till 7 pm on Tuesday in J&K
221.article_body: Mobile data services have been temporarily suspended in Jammu and Rajouri districts in Jammu and Kashmir till 7 pm on Tuesday. Jammu Zone ADGP passed the order fearing "misuse of services by anti-national elements that may cause deterioration in public order". This comes after J&K DG (Prisons) Hemant Lohia was found murdered at a house in Jammu on Monday night.

222.title: 'Adipurush' is most prestigious film in my life: Prabhas
222.article_body: Actor Prabhas said 'Adipurush' is "the most prestigious film" of his life. He shared that he said yes to the film because of director Om Raut's "intriguing screenplay and how it integrates the history and culture of India". Om Raut said 'Adipurush', which also stars Kriti Sanon, is an "extremely spiritual" as well as a commercial film.

223.title: Cried myself to bed: Rashmika on being trolled for Dear Comrade's kiss scene
223.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna said she used to wake up crying or cry herself to bed during the "painful days" of being trolled for a kissing scene in 'Dear Comrade'. She said during those days, she would have constant dreams about people turning their backs on her. "There were so many painful moments happening and painful things I would read," she said.

224.title: Delhi Police make first arrest of PFI members after ban, 4 held
224.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested four members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) after the Centre banned the group on September 28. It marks the first arrest of PFI members in the national capital after it was banned. Earlier, Delhi Police also raided 50 locations and arrested 32 people linked with PFI with the input of central agencies.

225.title: Vivek Agnihotri buys apartment worth around ₹18 crore in Mumbai: Report
225.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri and actress and his wife Pallavi Joshi have bought an apartment spread across an area of 3,258 sqft in Mumbai's Versova for ₹17.9 crore, according to reports. Agnihotri, whose 'The Kashmir Files' is one of the highest-grossing Indian films this year, reportedly paid stamp duty of ₹1.07 crore. The property was reportedly registered on September 27.

226.title: Terror angle being probed in J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia's murder, pic of suspect released
226.article_body: The initial investigation into Jammu and Kashmir DG (Prisons) Hemant Lohia's murder has pointed to the role of his domestic help Yasir Ahmed, ADGP Jammu Zone, Mukesh Singh said. CCTV footages reportedly showed Yasir running away after committing the crime. "So far no terror act is apparent but a thorough probe is on to rule out any possibility," Singh said.

227.title: Pakistani mother-daughter duo feature in Asia Cup 2022 as player, umpire
227.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Kainat Imtiaz and her mother Saleema, who is an umpire, are featuring in the ongoing Women's Asia Cup 2022. "I am so proud of what my mom has achieved. She has always been my inspiration," Kainat tweeted. She added that it was "always" her mother's dream to represent Pakistan.

228.title: Politics is about multiplication & division, not all of what's seen is true: Gehlot
228.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said politics is all about "multiplication and division". "In politics, sometimes, what is seen is not true and what is true is not seen," Gehlot added. Furthermore, he said that some organisations run news based on their perspective, which dents their credibility and does not serve any purpose.

229.title: We've our own way of playing & there's nothing wrong in it: PCB chief Raja
229.article_body: Reacting to criticism of Pakistan's approach in their recent T20I matches, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said it's easy to say that Pakistan are "still playing old school cricket" and they should start playing "aggressively like Australia". "The current team has a way to play and in my opinion, there is nothing wrong in it," he stated.

230.title: Aus to set aside 30% of its land mass to protect endangered species
230.article_body: Australia will set aside at least 30% of its land mass to help protect plants and animals in the island continent famous for its rare species, Minister for the Environment and Water, Tanya Plibersek said. The State of the Environment Report released in July showed that Australia has one of the worst rates of species decline among world's richest countries.

231.title: Journalists covering PM Modi's event in Himachal asked to give 'character certificates'
231.article_body: In order to get security passes to cover PM Narendra Modi's visit to Himachal Pradesh tomorrow, journalists have been asked to produce a "certificate of their character verification". These include privately-owned print, digital and news television journalists, and representatives of the All India Radio and Doordarshan. Earlier, PM's September 24 visit to Mandi was cancelled over bad weather.

232.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia not Nigeria: Scindia to Patole
232.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia reacted to Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole's allegation that Centre "deliberately" brought cheetahs to India from Nigeria to ensure the spread of lumpy skin disease and hurt farmers. Sharing Patole's video clip from the press conference, Scindia wrote, "Cheetahs were brought to India from Namibia, and not Nigeria Nana Patole Ji."

233.title: Everyone in country is laughing: BJP leader on Patole's 'cheetah' remark
233.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Mangal Prabhat Lodha said everyone in the country is laughing at his statement. Patole said, "Lumpy virus has been prevailing in Nigeria…cheetahs have also been brought from there."  Reacting to his remark, Lodha said, "Such observation is hilarious."

234.title: Fire breaks out at Ramlila pandal in UP's Etawah, no casualties reported
234.article_body: A fire broke out at a Ramlila 'pandal' due to a short circuit in UP's Etawah on Monday. No casualties or injuries were reported but the receipts of donations and some cash got burnt in the fire. The incident took place when the Ramlila stage was being prepared, police said. The fire was reportedly brought under control after 20 minutes.

235.title: We're both daughters of India: Priyanka Chopra tells US Vice President Kamala Harris
235.article_body: Priyanka Chopra recently interviewed US Vice President Kamala Harris and said, "I think we're both daughters of India, in a way." "You're a proud American-born daughter of an Indian mom and a Jamaican father. I'm an Indian born of two physicians as parents," the actress added. Priyanka was invited by the Democratic National Committee's Women's Leadership Forum to interview Harris.

236.title: New York City Mayor celebrates Durga Puja with Bengali community
236.article_body: New York City Mayor Eric Adams joined the Bengali community in Durga Puja celebrations in the city on Sunday. He was accompanied by New York City's Deputy Commissioner for International Affairs, Dilip Chauhan. "Durga Puja celebrates the triumph of good over evil. That's something we can all appreciate in these challenging times," Adam tweeted after attending the celebrations.

237.title: Sensex surges 1,200 points, Nifty above 17,200 as IT & bank stocks rally
237.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday, with the Sensex surging 1,236 points to 58,025 and the Nifty trading above 17,200 in opening trade. All the sectoral indices were trading in the green, led by Nifty IT and Nifty Bank. Hindalco Industries, IndusInd Bank, Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports and L&T were among major gainers on the Nifty.

238.title: Odia tribal man's hand, foot chopped off for demanding wage in UP
238.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal man's hand and foot were allegedly chopped off for demanding payment for his work at a cement factory in Uttar Pradesh in September. The victim, who hails from Odisha, said he was promised ₹20,000 a month but when he sought compensation, he was given two pouches of local liquor, after drinking which he fell unconscious.

239.title: Election Commission of India makes actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon'
239.article_body: The Election Commission of India made actor Pankaj Tripathi its 'national icon' on Monday afternoon. The actor was chosen for 'his association with ECI in creating awareness amongst voters'. Chief Election Commissioner, Rajiv Kumar, said that the decision to make Tripathi the national icon was done keeping in view his commitment to the cause and wide appeal across the country.

240.title: 4 Indian-origin people including 8-month-old baby kidnapped in US
240.article_body: An eight-month-old girl and her parents were among four people abducted from Merced County in California on Monday, authorities said. Merced County Sheriff's Office said that 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur, their eight-month-old baby Aroohi Dheri along with 39-year-old Amandeep Singh were taken against their will by an armed and dangerous suspect.

241.title: Ousted Burkina Faso military ruler Damiba in Togo after coup
241.article_body: Togo's government on Monday said Burkina Faso's ousted military ruler has arrived in Togo after rival officers seized power in a coup on Friday. Togo had taken in Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba for the sake of regional peace, it added. Damiba, who came to power in a coup last January, formally resigned on Sunday following an agreement with new junta.

242.title: Woman waves gun while dancing at an event in Bihar; video surfaces
242.article_body: A video of a woman waving a gun while dancing at an event in Bihar's Siwan has surfaced online. While some reports claimed that the woman brought the gun for protection, other reports claimed that she was handed over the gun by one of the men dancing with her. Notably, celebratory firing at public gatherings is a criminal offence.

243.title: SoftBank-backed Automation Anywhere raises $200 million in funding
243.article_body: US-based robotic process automation company Automation Anywhere has secured $200 million in a funding round from Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Capital, and Hercules Capital. The SoftBank-backed company was co-founded by Mihir Shukla, Neeti Mehta Shukla, Ankur Kothari and Rushabh Parmani in 2003. Automation Anywhere had earlier raised $290 million in a funding round led by Salesforce Ventures.

244.title: 35-yr-old man buying balloons in TN market dies as helium tank explodes
244.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed while he was buying balloons in a busy market street in Tamil Nadu. He died after a helium tank used to inflate balloons exploded in the market area. Reports said that several vehicles were damaged in the blast and people started running in all directions when the blast took place.

245.title: 6 injured in stone pelting during Navratri in Gujarat's Kheda
245.article_body: Six people were injured during Navratri celebrations in Gujarat's Kheda, said police. The incident occurred on Monday night when a group led by two people named Arif and Zahir started creating a disturbance, added police. "All the accused are being identified and strict action will be taken. Police have been deployed in the village," said Kheda DSP Rajesh Gadhiya.

246.title: Presented Brahmastra at international studio summit, met Kevin Feige: Ayan
246.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that he presented 'Brahmastra' at an international studio summit in Los Angeles where Disney had sent him. "I met Kevin Feige there and it was wonderful," he said, adding, "Astraverse plan came to life as we were bringing 'Brahmastra Part One' to life. I didn't always have this word Astraverse in mind when we first started."

247.title: 30 Delhi govt school principals to get training at Cambridge University
247.article_body: Around 30 principals from Delhi government schools and education department officials will be heading to the University of Cambridge, UK, for a leadership training programme next week, government officials said. The school principals will get leadership training for eight days at the university. "This will help us develop student-centric assessment practices," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

248.title: South Korean internet firm Naver to buy US e-commerce site Poshmark
248.article_body: South Korean internet firm Naver on Tuesday said that it will acquire Poshmark, a US apparel resale platform firm, in a $1.6 billion deal. Naver will acquire all of the issued and outstanding shares of Poshmark for $17.90 in cash. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of next year,  subject to approval by Poshmark stockholders.

249.title: India reports 1,968 new COVID-19 cases; lowest daily rise since May
249.article_body: India reported 1,968 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May. The active cases in the country now stand at 34,598, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,716.

250.title: Deepak Chahar one of the reasons why SA couldn't win in 2nd T20I: Nehra
250.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra has praised Deepak Chahar for his performance in the second SA T20I, stating that the 30-year-old was one of the reasons why the visitors couldn't chase down India's 238-run target. "He showed great variations which were tough for the batters to put away," added Nehra. Deepak conceded 24 runs in his four overs in the game.

251.title: F*** off is my very diplomatic reply: Ukrainian diplomat to Musk on plan to end war
251.article_body: Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany Andrij Melnyk responded after the world's richest person Elon Musk proposed a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine and suggested elections be held in annexed regions. "F*** off is my very diplomatic reply to you," Melnyk told Musk on his Twitter poll. "Now no Ukrainian will ever buy your f...ing Tesla crap," he added.

252.title: 40 arrested after communal clash between 2 groups in Gujarat's Vadodara
252.article_body: Gujarat Police arrested 40 persons after a communal clash broke out between two groups in Vadodara's Savli on Monday. "A Muslim festival is coming up...a local group tied their religious flag on an electronic pole. There is a temple nearby," police said. "Clash broke out after another local group went to convey how their religious sentiments were hurt," police added.

253.title: Robbers injure college student, snatch his gold ring in Pune
253.article_body: A second year B.Com student of Pune's Brihan Maharashtra College of Commerce was allegedly attacked by two knife-wielding men at Hanuman Tekdi. The victim, 19-year-old Varun Gupta, suffered injuries on his hand in the incident, while the attackers snatched away his gold ring. The victim was with his friends when the incident occurred, said police.

254.title: There's no other player whose absence means so much than Bumrah: Gavaskar
254.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said pacer Jasprit Bumrah's absence from India's squad will hurt them "considerably" in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "There's no other player in the Indian team, with due respect to every other player, whose absence means so much than Bumrah," stated Gavaskar. "With a bit of luck, [Arshdeep & Deepak] can fill in," he added.

255.title: Liquor sale banned for 2 days in parts of Bengaluru for Dussehra
255.article_body: In view of Dussehra celebrations, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city for two days. The prohibition orders have been issued in north, east, north-east and central Bengaluru from 7 am on Wednesday (October 5) to 12 pm on Thursday (October 6), the Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy said.

256.title: Russian journalist who called Putin 'killer' listed as wanted fugitive
256.article_body: Former Russian state television journalist Marina Ovsyannikova was on Monday put on Moscow's wanted list after her ex-husband reported she had escaped from pre-trial house arrest. The 44-year-old was placed under house arrest in August after she held a lone protest in July near the Kremlin carrying a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

257.title: Vodafone in talks with CK Hutchison's Three for possible merger in UK
257.article_body: Vodafone is in talks with Three UK, a carrier owned by CK Hutchison, for a possible merger. In a statement, Vodafone said that the envisaged transaction would involve both companies combining their UK businesses, with Vodafone owning 51% and CK Hutchison owning 49% of the combined business. The deal would not involve any cash consideration, Vodafone said.

258.title: Shammi Kapoor would have killed it if he could be on Instagram: Riteish
258.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh said that if late actor Shammi Kapoor could have been on Instagram, he would have killed it. "I think Shammi Kapoor sahaab...was one of the first people who were on the internet in India and he loved technology...And [imagine] the kind of flamboyance if it was Shammi sahaab on these platforms available in the 60s," he added.

259.title: Prashant Kishor is working on behalf of BJP: JD(U) chief
259.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh on Monday said that poll strategist Prashant Kishor is working "on behalf of BJP". "Kishor may give whatever name he chooses to his campaign but it does appear that he is working on behalf of the BJP. The type of publicity he is paying for raises the suspicion," Singh added.

260.title: Donald Trump sues CNN for defamation, seeks $475 million in damages
260.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against CNN, accusing the TV network of defaming him. CNN ran a "campaign of dissuasion in the form of libel and slander", which recently escalated "as CNN fears [Trump] will run for president in 2024", he claimed. Trump is seeking $475 million in damages for causing him "humiliation and mental anguish".

261.title: Told him I'll take rain check: Ratnam on Rajinikanth's interest in 'Ponniyin..'
261.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam said that superstar Rajinikanth may have lightly mentioned his interest in being a part of  'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "I can't just bring in a superstar, I have to be honest to the story. So I told him (Rajinikanth) [that] I will take a rain check with him about that," he added.

262.title: Cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore seized at Mumbai airport, passenger arrested
262.article_body: Mumbai airport customs on Monday seized 980 grams of cocaine worth ₹9.8 crore from a passenger who arrived from Ethiopia's capital, Addis Ababa. According to the customs, the contraband was concealed in the undergarments. The accused has been arrested and remanded to judicial custody.

263.title: Al-Shabaab terrorist with $3 mn bounty killed in US airstrike in Somalia
263.article_body: The US military said it had killed a leader of the al-Shabaab militant group in an airstrike in Somalia. The airstrike was carried out near Jilib in coordination with Somalia's government on October 1, it added. Abdullahi Nadir had a $3 million bounty on his head by the US. Nadir's "death is a thorn removed from the...nation", Somali government said.

264.title: 2 salespersons steal jewellery worth ₹8.10 lakh from shop in Pune
264.article_body: Two salespersons working at a jewellery shop in Pune were arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond ornaments worth ₹8.10 lakh. According to police, the accused initially stole one ornament for making quick money and then continued doing so as no staff suspected them. The police have recovered some of the stolen gold ornaments.

265.title: BMC sets aside ₹790 crore for 1st phase of Mumbai's beautification work
265.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has set aside ₹790 crore funds for the first phase of Mumbai's beautification plan which will include illumination and developmental work across the city. The civic body has allocated a total of ₹1,700 crore as part of this beautification plan which will be spent in phases over the course of the next three months.

266.title: 3 arrested for duping 50 people of ₹4-5 cr in loan fraud case in Pune
266.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested three persons in a loan fraud case for cheating at least 50 persons of ₹4-5 crore. The accused allegedly collected loan documents and a token amount of ₹2-3 lakh from each applicant, police said. "The accused did not have any licence for lending business nor did they have a tie-up with a financial institute," police added.

267.title: AAP to burn Ravan effigies made of garbage in 3,500 locations across Delhi
267.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will burn effigies of Ravan made of garbage at about 3,500 locations in Delhi today as a protest against BJP's "failure" to maintain cleanliness in national capital, the Arvind Kejriwal-led party said. AAP will hold protests after burning effigies and call for municipal polls to be held "at the earliest", AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak said.

268.title: Rana Daggubati receives golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar, shares pic
268.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati received a golden bust of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. Sharing a picture of the same on Twitter on Monday, he wrote, "The most beautiful memory came into my office today. Miss you my friend." Puneeth Rajkumar passed away aged 46 in October last year after suffering a heart attack.

269.title: J&K DG Prisons Hemant Lohia found dead with slit throat, police look for domestic help
269.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Prisons Hemant Lohia was found dead at his house on Monday night. A murder probe has been launched while the suspect, his domestic help, is absconding. Lohia's domestic help reportedly first suffocated him to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

270.title: Shimron Hetmyer dropped from West Indies' T20 World Cup 2022 squad after missing flight
270.article_body: Batter Shimron Hetmyer has been dropped from West Indies' squad for T20 World Cup 2022 after missing his flight to Australia. Hetmyer missed his re-scheduled flight to Australia, which had been changed to Monday from Saturday at his request, due to family reasons. Hetmyer has been replaced by Shamarh Brooks in the squad.

271.title: India's unemployment rate drops to 6.43% in September, lowest in 4 years
271.article_body: India's unemployment rate fell to the lowest in over four years in September to 6.43%, according to data revealed by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy. The rate is the lowest since August 2018 as compared to this year's high of 8.3% in August. The decline was reported as close to 10 million jobs were added during September.

272.title: People warned to take shelter in Japan as N Korea fires missile; it lands in Pacific Ocean
272.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired an intermediate-range ballistic missile over Japan, forcing the country to alert residents in northeastern regions to evacuate to shelters. Japan said the missile flew over Japan and is believed to have landed into the Pacific Ocean. This was Japan's first 'J-alert' alert since 2017, when North Korea fired a Hwasong-12 missile over the nation.

273.title: 33-yr-old accused of killing constable in Delhi riots arrested in UP
273.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested from UP's Aligarh for allegedly killing head constable Ratan Lal during the 2020 Delhi riots. The accused, identified as Mohammed Wasim, was declared a "proclaimed offender" by the Delhi High Court, police said. Apart from Lal, the then Shahdara DCP Amit Sharma and then ACP Gokalpuri Anuj Kumar had also sustained severe injuries, police stated.

274.title: Hyderabad Metro launches facility to let commuters book tickets on WhatsApp
274.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail has launched the facility to book tickets on WhatsApp. Commuters will be able to purchase e-tickets on their WhatsApp number. They will be required to send a 'Hi' message to Hyderabad Metro Rail on a number. An OTP will then be sent to the commuters along with an e-ticket booking link.

275.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner files identity theft complaint for 2nd time
275.article_body: For the second time in three months, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath filed a police complaint against fraudulent use of his identity. The suspect chatted with people known to Nath using his display picture on WhatsApp and sent them requests for Amazon gift cards and links for purchases, said police.

276.title: Hyd man pours fuel on his bike, sets it ablaze after being stopped by police
276.article_body: A man poured fuel on his motorcycle and set it on fire after police stopped him for traffic offence. Reports said he was stopped as he was moving in the wrong direction on the road. Traffic police alerted the local law and order police, who arrived and extinguished the fire. Police said that the man is a regular traffic offender.

277.title: Zelenskyy starts poll on Musk after his 'Ukraine-Russia peace' plan, billionaire replies
277.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy started a Twitter poll on Elon Musk after the billionaire asked Twitter users to vote on a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine. "Which @elonmusk do you like more?" Zelenskyy tweeted, with the options - one who supports Ukraine and one who supports Russia. Responding to it, Musk wrote, "I still very much support Ukraine."

278.title: SpaceX spent $80 million out of its pocket for Ukraine, $0 for Russia: Musk
278.article_body: Elon Musk has said that SpaceX's out-of-pocket cost to support Ukraine has been $80 million so far. "Our support for Russia is $0. Obviously, we are pro Ukraine," he added. His tweet came after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took a poll asking people which Musk they like more, the one who supports Ukraine or the one who supports Russia.

279.title: Riots engineered by US, Israel: Iran's Ayatollah on protests over woman's death
279.article_body: In his first public comments on the civil unrest stemming from 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in Iranian police custody, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said, "This rioting was planned." He added, "These riots and the insecurity were engineered by America and the occupying, false Zionist regime [Israel], as well as their paid agents." He said Amini's death "broke our hearts".

280.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook meets Pope Francis in private meeting at Vatican
280.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook was granted a "private audience" with Pope Francis at the Vatican on Monday. However, the Vatican did not disclose what was discussed between the two during the meeting. Cook had previously met the Pope in 2016. The Pope earlier warned people against becoming slaves to mobile phones and other forms of technology.

281.title: Britannia acquires 51% equity share in Kenya's Kenafric Biscuits
281.article_body: Britannia Industries has acquired a controlling stake in Kenya-based Kenafric Biscuits for ₹9.2 crore. In a filing, Britannia said that it has subscribed to 51% of the equity share capital of the company. The deal was completed in cash consideration and the acquisition was completed on October 3. Britannia said the acquisition's objective was to sell biscuits in African markets.

282.title: Lenskart Co-founder Neha Bansal buys property in Delhi for ₹22 cr: Report
282.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder Neha Bansal has reportedly purchased a 400-square yard bungalow in south Delhi's Greater Kailash area for ₹22 crore. Bansal currently has a net worth of ₹1,540 crore and was one of the new entrants on the Hurun Wealthy Women List 2021. Healthcare platform PharmEasy's Co-founder Siddharth Shah also bought a duplex in Mumbai's Khar for ₹40 crore.

283.title: 62-year-old ex-Indian Army officer completes third Ironman triathlon
283.article_body: Major General Vikram Dev Dogra (retd) completed his third Ironman triathlon in Barcelona, Spain. In 2018, the now 62-year-old had become the first serving Indian Army officer to complete the event which comprises 3.8 km of swimming, 180 km cycling and 42.2 km of running. Dogra served in the Indian Army for around 38 years.

284.title: Skipper Temba Bavuma is weakest link in South African team: RP Singh
284.article_body: After South Africa lost the 2nd T20I on Sunday, ex-Indian pacer RP Singh said that Proteas skipper Temba Bavuma is the "weakest link" in the African side. "Even Rilee Rossouw wasn't able to get any runs. Had these two (Bavuma-Rossouw) played well, South Africa would have got a better start...It is important to capitalise on the powerplay," Singh said.

285.title: Xhaka apologised to Arsenal squad at half-time against Tottenham: Report
285.article_body: Arsenal midfielder Granit Xhaka reportedly apologised to his teammates at half-time during the match against Tottenham Hotspur for his role in the penalty awarded to the opposition. Xhaka reportedly shouldered the blame saying he was unable to clear his lines, even though Gabriel's foul on Richarlison led to the decision. Arsenal beat Tottenham 3-1 on Saturday at the Emirates Stadium.

286.title: Want to keep Chris Gayle's bat as a prized possession: Yusuf Pathan
286.article_body: Former India batter Yusuf Pathan said he would like to keep former West Indies captain Chris Gayle's bat as a memento. "I get to learn so much from him. I would really like to have his bat and keep it as a prized possession," said Pathan. Gayle responded that he is open to the idea of exchanging bats with Pathan.

287.title: Centre denies permission to RJD MP Manoj Jha to visit Pakistan
287.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) MP Manoj K Jha was denied 'political clearance' by the Centre to visit Pakistan to address an event. Jha said while he got clearance from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), he was denied political clearance by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA). Jha was planning to enter the neighbouring country via the Wagah Border.

288.title: Ahead of IPO, Electronics Mart India raises ₹150 cr from investors
288.article_body: Electronics retailer Electronics Mart India has raised ₹150 crore from anchor investors ahead of its initial public offering (IPO). Its IPO will open on October 4 and close on October 7 at a price of ₹59 per share, according to the filings with the exchange. Through the anchor book, a total of 20 investors have invested in the company.

289.title: Far from acceptable: Man Utd's Eriksen on 6-3 loss to Man City
289.article_body: After Manchester United was defeated by Manchester City by a margin of 6-3 in the Premier League on Sunday, the former club's midfielder, Christian Eriksen, said that their performance was "far from acceptable". "We started on the wrong foot...We can only blame ourselves. There are a lot of things we need to change," the 30-year-old Danish footballer said.

290.title: Bihar girl who asked for subsidised pads wants to meet CM Nitish
290.article_body: Bihar girl Riya Kumari, who asked for subsidised sanitary pads from IAS officer Harjot Kaur Bamhrah, said that Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is yet to meet her. She said that she wants to meet the CM face to face so that "he can listen to what I want to say". She added that she wants to make a bigger difference.

291.title: SP workers pray for Mulayam Yadav's long life in temples across UP
291.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) workers organised special prayers in temples across UP for the long life of party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who is currently admitted to the CCU. Ajay Yadav, a party leader, said that he was ready to donate his kidney if needed. The party took to Twitter to say that it will update about his health condition regularly.

292.title: 16-year-old boy forced to perform puja without clothes in Karnataka, 3 arrested
292.article_body: A case was registered and three persons were arrested in Karnataka’s Koppal after a 16-year-old boy was allegedly lured to strip naked and perform puja to clear his father’s debts. The police said the accused shared a video of the same on social media. The accused had threatened to murder the boy's father if he disclosed incident to anyone else.

293.title: That was 4 yrs ago: Akram to Pak batter's statement on hitting sixes in Aus
293.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Wasim Akram reacted to batter Iftikhar Ahmed's saying that "hitting sixes in big Australian grounds is not a problem" for him. "I read Iftikhar's statement...He was named the Player of the Match and Player of the Series in Australia, that was 4 years ago man. This is a different ball game, a World Cup," Akram said.

294.title: ISRO issues statement as Mars orbiter loses contact, says 'it is non-recoverable'
294.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) confirmed it has lost contact with its Mars orbiter, calling the mission "a remarkable technological and scientific feat". "Despite being [built] for a life span of six months....the Mars Orbiter Mission has lived for about eight years," said ISRO. "It was declared that the spacecraft is non-recoverable and attained its end-of-life," it added.

295.title: People wrote me off too early: Archer Atanu on reaching National Games final
295.article_body: After reaching men's individual recurve final at 36th National Games, archer Atanu Das said people wrote him off too early after a "tough" Tokyo Olympics. "I was mentally exhausted after the loss...it was tough to deal with, so I decided to take a two-month break...critics completely changed the narrative," he added. Atanu defeated veteran Tarundeep Rai 6-0 in semi-final.

296.title: Lakhimpur Kheri victims' families still awaiting justice: Tikait
296.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait said families of those who died in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence are yet to get justice and the nation will never forget the incident. "The ruling dispensation neither believes in the legal system, nor the Constitution," said Tikait. Meanwhile, BKU (Doaba) members assembled in Punjab in observance of the first year anniversary of the violence.

297.title: Supreme Court sends notice to UP govt over bail to Owaisi attackers
297.article_body: The Supreme Court issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government on a plea filed by AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi challenging the bail granted to two accused of firing at his vehicle in February this year. The bench also issued notices to the two accused, Sachin Pandit and Shubham Gurjar. They were released on bail on August 3.

298.title: Video of angry Pakistani fans chanting 'Parchi, Parchi' for Khushdil Shah goes viral
298.article_body: A video has gone viral showing angry fans in the stadium chanting 'Parchi, Parchi' for Pakistan batter Khushdil Shah. Pakistani cricketer Imam-ul-Haq shared a video and wrote, "I'd like to request our fans to avoid such rants at any player as it can badly impact...player’s health." Khushdil scored 63 runs in four T20I innings against England in the recently-concluded series.

299.title: Women's T20 World Cup 2023 fixtures announced, India to face Pakistan on February 12
299.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the schedule for the Women's T20 World Cup 2023, which will begin on February 10 in South Africa. India are placed in Group 2 with England, West Indies, Pakistan and Ireland. India will face Pakistan on February 12. India will face West Indies, England, and Ireland on February 15, 18 and 20, respectively.

300.title: ICC names 5 players tipped to shine during T20 World Cup 2022
300.article_body: The ICC, on its official website, has named five players tipped to shine during the T20 World Cup 2022. The five players are Australia opener David Warner, Sri Lanka all-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga, England captain Jos Buttler, India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan wicketkeeper-opener Muhammad Rizwan. "You will struggle to find a more consistent T20I batter than Rizwan," the article read.

301.title: Delhi court dismisses statutory bail plea of DHFL promoters Wadhawan brothers
301.article_body: A Delhi court has dismissed the statutory bail plea of former Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited promoters Kapil Wadhawan and his brother Dheeraj. CBI had arrested the two accused over a bank loan scam case. Judge Vishal Gogne noted that the accused were also charged with section 409, providing a maximum period of 90 days to file the charge sheet.

302.title: UK artist 'Mr Doodle' covers his ₹12 crore mansion completely with doodles
302.article_body: British artist Sam Cox, popularly known as 'Mr Doodle', has completely covered his mansion with doddles drawn by him in two years. The mansion, initially bought by the artist for more than ₹12 crore, now has every inch, from his bedding to his microwave and even door knobs, covered in doodles. He called it his "best piece of work".

303.title: World's richest man Musk runs poll for Ukraine-Russia peace, says 'please vote'
303.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Monday took to Twitter to create a poll suggesting ways to achieve peace between Ukraine and Russia. "Please vote on this poll," Musk urged the public. "Also worth noting that a possible, albeit unlikely, outcome from this conflict is nuclear war," Musk said in another tweet.

304.title: Siva breaks 35-year-old National Games men's pole vault record
304.article_body: Siva Subramaniam broke his national record as he won the men's pole vault gold medal at the 36th National Games in Gujarat on Monday. Siva cleared 5.31m, improving his mark of 5.30m set in 2018. Siva, representing Services, broke the 35-year-old National Games record of 5.10m set by Vijay Pal Singh in Kerala.

305.title: Mamallapuram beats Taj with highest foreign visitors in FY 21-22
305.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Mamallapuram has, according to a Tourism Ministry report, beaten the Taj Mahal in terms of the number of foreign tourists visiting the spot in FY 2021-2022. The UNESCO world heritage site saw 1,44,984 foreign visitors, while the second-placed Taj Mahal saw 38,922 foreign tourists. Six of the top 10 monuments on the list are in Tamil Nadu.

306.title: Families of victims in Lakhimpur incident are disappointed: Priyanka
306.article_body: On the first anniversary of the Lakhimpur Kheri incident, where farmers were run over by a vehicle, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said that the victims' families are "disappointed" because the trial has been "sluggish". "Despite the agitation of the farmers, neither did they get the law on MSP, nor justice for the martyred farmers," Priyanka said.

307.title: This is not 2008, Credit Suisse stock 'a buy for the brave': Citi
307.article_body: Credit Suisse stock at its current levels is "a buy for the brave", but with significant risk attached to it, Citigroup analysts said. On Credit Suisse's situation being compared to the Lehman Brothers' bankruptcy in 2008, the analysts said, "This is not 2008". Credit Suisse shares slid by as much as 11.5% and its bonds hit record lows on Monday.

308.title: AAP ready to be the change Gujarat is looking for: Raghav Chadha
308.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said the people of Gujarat were looking for a change and his party "is ready to take on that responsibility". Taking out a roadshow in the state, Chadha alleged BJP was making "fake surveys" to show that it is winning the state elections. He also urged corporators to join hands and uproot the "corrupt" BJP government.

309.title: BSF seizes abandoned boat near Pak border, people aboard swim away
309.article_body: The BSF seized an abandoned Pakistani fishing boat near Bhuj in Gujarat, along the India-Pakistan maritime boundary. "A few people were seen on the boat, but they...swam towards the Pakistan side. Icebox, jerry can and fishing net have been seized," said a BSF official. In May 2022, BSF seized four country-made Pakistani fishing boats near the same area.

310.title: Youth chops off palm over corruption in Bihar, offers it to Lord Ram
310.article_body: A youth in UP's Ayodhya severed his palm after offering prayers at Saryu river's bank to mark his protest against corruption in Bihar government. Bihar's Vimal Kumar said he'd written several letters to Bihar CM and had pledged to chop off the palm he'd used to write those letters. This might change mindset of people running Bihar government, Kumar said.

311.title: India's GDP growth to decline to 5.7% in 2022: UN agency
311.article_body: A UN agency has forecasted that India's economic growth is expected to fall to 5.7% in 2022 from 8.2% in 2021. United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) said, "As economic activity is hampered by higher financing cost and weaker public expenditures, GDP growth is projected to decelerate to 5.7% in 2022."

312.title: Turkey's annual inflation hits new 24-year high of 83.45%
312.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation reached a new 24-year high of 83.45% in September, official data showed. Turkish Statistical Institute said that consumer prices increased by 3.08% from the last month. Turkey's inflation has surged following cuts to the policy rate by the central bank. The bank cut its policy rate by 200 basis points to 12% in the last two months.

313.title: RBI sells dollars as rising oil prices lowers rupee to near record low: Reports
313.article_body: According to reports, the RBI has sold dollars via state-run banks as rising global oil rates and weak risk appetite caused the rupee to dip to near record low level. The rupee was last trading at 81.90 against the US dollar, down from 81.34 in the previous session. The local unit reached a record low of 81.95 last Wednesday.

314.title: ED raids 12 firms in B'luru, seizes ₹5.85 cr in fraud case involving Chinese persons
314.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has raided 12 firms in Bengaluru and seized ₹5.85 crore in a part-time job fraud case involving some Chinese persons and apps. Investigations under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act revealed that the accused cheated people through a mobile app called 'Keepsharer', which collected money from them on the promise of offering part-time jobs.

315.title: Mahesh Babu immerses his mother Indira Devi's ashes in Haridwar
315.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu on Sunday immersed the ashes of his mother Indira Devi in Ganga in Haridwar. He also performed a puja for his late mother. Indira Devi passed away on September 28 at a private hospital in Hyderabad. Her mortal remains were kept at Padmalaya Studios for fans to pay their last respects.

316.title: Sandeep Kumar Gupta appointed as GAIL Chairman and Managing Director
316.article_body: GAIL (India) Limited has announced the appointment of Sandeep Kumar Gupta as the Chairman & Managing Director of the company. Gupta, who previously served as Director (Finance) at Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), replaces Manoj Jain, whose term ended on August 31. Gupta said the company is aligned with the government's vision of having a gas-based economy.

317.title: Punjab announces hike in sugarcane price to ₹380 per quintal
317.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has announced increasing the price of sugarcane to ₹380 per quintal from ₹360 per quintal. With this decision, the state government will spend an additional ₹200 crore annually on sugarcane. Mann said the farmers of the state eagerly want to adopt sugarcane crops under crop diversification but are hesitant due to a lack of adequate prices.

318.title: PFRDA proposes changes to allow systematic lumpsum withdrawals for NPS subscribers
318.article_body: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has proposed changes to its guidelines to allow Systematic Lumpsum Withdrawal for the National Pension Scheme (NPS) subscribers. The "smart withdrawal facility" will allow subscribers to withdraw the amount either monthly, quarterly, half-yearly, or annually for up to 75 years. PFRDA said the changes aim to make the process effortless.

319.title: Tiger celebrates 3 years of 'War', shares old videos with Hrithik
319.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff took to his Instagram Stories on Sunday to celebrate three years of his action-thriller film 'War'. He shared some old videos with co-star Hrithik Roshan. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, collected over ₹400 crore worldwide. It also featured Vaani Kapoor, Ashutosh Rana and Anupria Goenka among others in pivotal roles.

320.title: Man Utd turned down €20 million deal to sign Haaland in 2019: Reports
320.article_body: Manchester United reportedly turned down an opportunity to sign forward Erling Haaland for €20 million during the 2019 winter transfer window. United's former executive Ed Woodward reportedly didn't approve the deal due to "hefty" agent fees and contract demands. Haaland became the fastest Premier League player to score three hat-tricks during Manchester City's 6-3 win over United on Sunday.

321.title: Vodafone UK in talks with CK Hutchison's Three UK for possible merger
321.article_body: Vodafone confirmed that its UK arm is in talks with CK Hutchison for a merger with Three UK. The deal would see Vodafone owning 51% of the entity while CK Hutchison would own 49%. According to reports, the merger is aimed at creating a market-leading operator to accelerate the launch of 5G in Britain.

322.title: Centre to approach capital market to raise funds for road projects: Official
322.article_body: A government official stated that government will approach the capital market this month to raise around ₹2,500 crore to fund three road projects. The official added that the money will be raised through Infrastructure Investment Trusts (InvITs). InvITs are instruments designed to pool money from investors and invest in assets that will provide cash flows over a time period.

323.title: Man's wife files RTI to know his salary details after he refuses to share them
323.article_body: A woman filed an application under the Right to Information (RTI) Act after her husband refused to share details of his income with her. The Central Information Commission (CIC) directed the Central Public Information Officer (CPIO), Bareilly to inform her about her husband's gross and net taxable incomes in 15 days. Her previous appeals to CPIO and FAA were dismissed.

324.title: Om Raut has designed it for present generation: Prabhas on 'Adipurush'
324.article_body: Actor Prabhas, speaking about his upcoming film 'Adipurush', said that director Om Raut has designed it for the present generation. "Om designed it for the kids and families," he said, adding, "Even women love my action, so there's a lot of action. And, he designed it in a commercial way, so I think it's very happy news for the fans."

325.title: 6,093 trees felled for tiger safari in Uttarakhand's Corbett: FSI
325.article_body: Uttarakhand Forest Department felled 6,093 trees for a tiger safari in Corbett Tiger Reserve, Forest Survey of India's (FSI) report said. "There was permission for felling of 163 trees. But later, we found that 97 more trees had been cut...We want to understand how FSI has arrived at this 6,093 figure?" said Uttarakhand's Principal Chief Conservator of Forests Vinod Kumar.

326.title: India's coal production rises 12% to 57.93 mn tonnes in September
326.article_body: According to the provisional statistics of the Coal Ministry, India's overall coal production increased by 12.01% to 57.93 million tonnes (MT) in September 2022 from 51.72 MT in September 2021. Further, the dispatch of coal to power utilities increased to 51.71 MT during the last month. Coal-based power generation has registered a growth of 13.40% in September 2022.

327.title: Oil prices jump nearly $4 amid reports of OPEC+ planning output cut
327.article_body: Oil prices rose nearly $4 on Monday amid reports of OPEC+ planning to cut its output by over 1 million barrels per day, which would be its biggest cut since the pandemic began, to support the market. Brent crude futures jumped by 4.1% to $88.60 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude was up 4.3% at $82.88 per barrel.

328.title: World no. 1 Swiatek skips Billie Jean King Cup Finals due to scheduling issues
328.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek will not play for Poland in Billie Jean King Cup Finals in Glasgow due to scheduling issues. The tournament will be held from November 8-13, one day after the season-ending WTA Finals which will be held in Fort Worth, US. "I'm going to talk to...WTA and ITF in order to change something," said Swiatek.

329.title: Motilal Oswal PE arm raises ₹4,500 crore for new platform
329.article_body: A private equity fund promoted by domestic brokerage Motilal Oswal Alternatives (MOA) announced that it has raised ₹4,500 crore for a new platform. The funds were raised from high net-worth individuals and family offices by MOA for the India Business Excellence Fund (IBEF) IV. With the latest close, the overall assets under management for MOA touched ₹14,000 crore.

330.title: Fan books room for ₹23,400 for a night in same hotel as Team India to meet Virat Kohli
330.article_body: A fan named Rahul Rai booked a room for ₹23,400 for a night in the same hotel where Team India players were staying in Guwahati to meet Virat Kohli. Rai booked the room after he was unable to meet Kohli at airport and during practice sessions. Rai met Kohli at the hotel and clicked a selfie.

331.title: Mukesh Kumar learns about his maiden India call-up after being added to WhatsApp group
331.article_body: Bengal fast bowler Mukesh Kumar came to know about his maiden Team India call-up after being added to the Team India's official WhatsApp group. Mukesh, who is currently in Rajkot playing for Rest of India in the Irani Cup, said, "I got very emotional. It was all blur." Mukesh has been selected for India's ODI series against South Africa.

332.title: Haaland needs his teammates, Messi can do it alone: Man City manager
332.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola pointed out the difference between forwards Erling Haaland and Lionel Messi by praising the latter's individual ability. "The difference is that Erling needs maybe all his mates...Messi had the ability for himself to do it," said Guardiola. He added that Haaland has "incredible instincts" and he was born with the ability to score goals.

333.title: SEBI gives nod to Deltatech Gaming, Pristine Logistics to float IPO
333.article_body: Deltatech Gaming and Pristine Logistics & Infraprojects received SEBI's nod to raise funds through an IPO. As per the DRHP, Deltatech's ₹550 crore IPO comprises of a fresh issuance of ₹300 crore worth equity shares and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of ₹250 crore. Pristine Logistics' IPO includes fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹250 crore and OFS of 20,066,269 equity shares.

334.title: New pic of UK royal family taken before the Queen's funeral released
334.article_body: Buckingham Palace has unveiled a new picture of the royal family that was taken the night before Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. The portrait shows King Charles III, Camilla Parker Bowles, Prince William and Kate Middleton, all dressed in black as per the mourning custom. Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were absent from the photograph.

335.title: Johar spoke to me about 'Maja Ma' long back, I forgot about it: Madhuri
335.article_body: Speaking about why she signed for 'Maja Ma', actress Madhuri Dixit said, "[The subject] was so good, it was so poignant, hilarious. It has all the factors...yet there's a sense of humour to it." She revealed that Karan Johar had spoken to her about the film. "[He said] there's a good subject. Then I forgot about it," Madhuri further added.

336.title: Top seed Djokovic wins Tel Aviv final for 89th career title
336.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic defeated second seed Marin Cilic 6-3, 6-4 to win his third title of 2022 and 89th career title at Tel Aviv Watergen Open on Sunday. With this, the 35-year-old Serbian became the first man to win a title on hard, clay(Rome) and grass(Wimbledon) courts this season. It was Djokovic's 19th victory over Cilic in 21 meetings.

337.title: India increases import duty on platinum to 15.4%
337.article_body: The government has released a notification increasing the total import duty on platinum to 15.4% from 10.75%. The move is aimed at bringing parity in the import duty structure between gold and platinum. The government had raised the import duty on gold to 15% in July but had kept the tax on platinum imports unchanged at 10.75%.

338.title: It amuses me when people write long columns about 'Koffee With...': Johar
338.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar opened up about him receiving feedback for talking about people's sex lives and Alia Bhatt during his talk show 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "What amuses me is that there are long columns that people write...it's a frivolous fun talk show," he added. Karan further called 'Koffee With Karan' and 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' cringe binges.

339.title: Kajol-starrer 'Salaam Venky' to release in theatres on December 9
339.article_body: Actress Kajol's 'Salaam Venky' is all set to release in theatres on December 9. The film is billed as an incredible true story of a mother's strength when faced with challenges. It is helmed by actress-director Revathy. Kajol will also be seen in the show 'The Good Wife', in which she'll share screen space with Kubbra Sait and Sheeba Chadha.

340.title: Even those who spread poison are raising issues of poverty: Jairam on RSS
340.article_body:
Congress MP Jairam Ramesh commented on RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's statement on the need to address poverty, income inequality and unemployment in the country.
"Look at the impact of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Even those (RSS) who break the country and spread poison in the society are raising the issues of poverty, unemployment and inequality," Ramesh said.

341.title: Russian who masterminded JEE 2021 paper leak detained from Delhi airport by CBI
341.article_body: A Russian national, said to be the mastermind behind the JEE (Mains) 2021 exam paper leak, was detained by CBI from Delhi airport and is being questioned, officials said on Monday. The man, reportedly identified as Mikhail Shargin, is said to be the main hacker behind the alleged scam. Affinity Education Private Limited was earlier booked in the case.

342.title: Shahid inspires me through performances in Haider, Kabir Singh: Varun
342.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said that he is driven when actors do better films than him. Speaking about Shahid Kapoor, Varun said, "He's [given] such great performances whether it's 'Haider' whether it's 'Kabir Singh'...or 'Jab We Met'. So that definitely inspires me and I feel like wow man." Shahid recently featured in 'Jersey', whereas, Varun featured in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'.

343.title: Prashant Kishor raising unimportant issues, silent on pressing ones: RJD
343.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Jha on Monday said political strategist Prashant Kishor is raising unimportant issues and is "silent on those he should speak on". This comes after Kishor said "nothing has changed" in Bihar since 1990 as it continues to be "poorest and most backward" in India. "I don't need to understand rocket science to understand Kishor's script," Jha said.

344.title: HDFC assigns ₹9,145 crore loans to HDFC Bank in Q2 FY23
344.article_body: Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) Limited has said it has assigned loans worth ₹9,145 crore to HDFC Bank during the quarter ended September 30 (Q2FY23). The company further said loans worth ₹34,513 crore were sold in the preceding 12 months. HDFC's gross income from dividends for Q2 was ₹1,360 crore, while the profit on the sale of investments was NIL.

345.title: Indian men's and women's hockey teams to play Test series vs Australia
345.article_body: Indian men's and women's hockey teams will travel to Australia to play five-match test series against the hosts' national teams. The men's series will be held from November 26 to December 4 in Adelaide. The women's series is scheduled to take place in May 2023. The final dates for it are yet to be confirmed.

346.title: Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra revoke several offer letters given to freshers: Report
346.article_body: Wipro, Infosys and Tech Mahindra revoked several offer letters given to freshers after delaying the onboarding process for months, The Hindu BusinessLine reported. It quoted emails sent by these companies saying the candidates didn't meet the companies' academic eligibility criteria or assessment guidelines. "We'll honour all offer letters made to deserving candidates," Wipro said in a statement.

347.title: I wish them best: Rodriguez on ex-fiancée Jennifer Lopez's wedding
347.article_body: Former baseball player Alex Rodriguez reacted to his ex-fiancée Jennifer Lopez tying the knot with actor Ben Affleck. "I wish her and the children, who are smart, and beautiful and wonderful, I wish them the very best," Alex stated. Lopez and Rodriguez began dating in 2017 and later got engaged, however, the duo broke up in 2021.

348.title: Need wickets from Ashwin; his 0/37 is not great return: Chopra
348.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra said that spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's bowling figure of 0/37 against South Africa in the 2nd T20I was not a "great return". "Ashwin has now bowled eight overs without a wicket...I need wickets...If you don't pick wickets, you have to hold back Axar because of the left-handers and then they cash in when you have no choice."

349.title: Jasprit Bumrah ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022
349.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to a back injury. "The decision was taken following a detailed assessment and in consultation with the specialists," the BCCI said in statement. The BCCI will be naming a replacement for Bumrah in the squad for the marquee tournament soon.

350.title: Huge worrying sign as Harshal, Arshdeep will play in WC: Chopra
350.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on pacers Arshdeep Singh and Harshal Patel giving away 62 runs and 45 runs respectively against South Africa on Sunday.
