"The two (Harshal-Arshdeep) fast bowlers together gave away 107 runs in eight overs. These pacers will play in the [upcoming T20] World Cup, so it is a huge worrying sign," Chopra said.

351.title: Internal documents posted online, no evidence of cyberattack: Ferrari
351.article_body: Ferrari on Monday said some of its internal documents had been posted online and that it was working to identify cause of the issue. Ferrari added that it had no evidence of a breach of its systems or of ransomware and that there had been no disruption to its business and operations. We'll implement appropriate actions as needed, Ferrari added.

352.title: 'Bade Miyan...' is in zone of cinema we used to see in 80s: Director
352.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has said that Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' is a "buddy film". "It's in the zone of cinema we used to see in the 80s when Amitabh Bachchan, Vinod Khanna, Dharmendra used to come together," Ali added. He revealed that they will begin shooting in the first week of January next year.

353.title: With his current form, he can win us 5 out of 100 games: Hameed on Pak's Asif
353.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Yasir Hameed said Asif Ali is Pakistan's 'X-factor' but the batter hasn't delivered consistently for the team. "With his current form, he can win us only five matches out of a 100, which is a low percentage," he added. Asif managed seven runs off nine balls in Pakistan's 67-run loss in the T20I series decider against England.

354.title: Karnataka has the most corrupt government in India: Rahul Gandhi
354.article_body: Addressing a rally in Karnataka during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "Karnataka has the most corrupt government in India." "This government charges 40% commission from farmers, labourers and small and medium businessmen," he said. "Karnataka contractors wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi about 40% commission, but PM didn't take any action," he added.

355.title: Salman would look for beggars at night to donate food from sets: Jhulka
355.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka recalled working with actor Salman Khan and said she would see him packing the food on sets after the shoot finished. "He would make an effort to find a beggar, even if it was late at night...stepping out of his car and giving that food," she added. Ayesha made her Bollywood debut in Salman's 1991 film 'Kurbaan'.

356.title: Principles more important than venue: Maha CM ahead of Dussehra rally
356.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, ahead of the Dussehra rally by his faction, said that "principles are important irrespective of the venue". Shinde faction's rally will be held at the MMRDA ground in Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC), while the Uddhav Thackeray faction's rally will be held at Shivaji Park in central Mumbai.

357.title: Telecom industry pays 58% of revenue as taxes, highest in world: Vi CEO
357.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra has urged the government to reduce levies on the telecom sector to enable them to improve cash generation and increase investments in capital-intensive 5G networks. He said, "In a country where tariffs are the lowest, India's telecom industry has the highest levies anywhere in...world." Government levies amount to 58% of industry revenues, he added.

358.title: K'taka CM thanks govt employee for helping man apply for education loan
358.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai thanked Pavan, a government employee in Mangalore, for helping a man apply for a government-sponsored education loan for his niece. "Our thanks to Pawan and thousands of officers...who are working tirelessly round-the-clock to deliver such governance," Bommai said. Pavan had helped the man apply for the loan offline after they faced issues applying for it online.

359.title: Don't carry ads of online betting platforms: Govt to pvt channels & OTT platforms
359.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has issued an advisory asking OTT platforms and private satellite channels to refrain from publishing online betting ads. Saying that betting and gambling are illegal activities in most parts of India, the advisory added, "Online offshore betting platforms appear to be promoting betting and gambling under the garb of news as surrogate advertising."

360.title: Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to spread lumpy skin disease: Cong
360.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Monday said the Centre "deliberately" brought cheetahs to India to ensure the spread of lumpy skin disease and hurt farmers. "This lumpy virus has been prevailing in Nigeria for a long time and the Cheetahs have also been brought from there," Patole said while talking to reporters.

361.title: People said bad things about Sonakshi after my tweet on KRK: Shatrughan
361.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha revealed that his tweet supporting Kamaal R Khan over his arrest received backlash. "People said nasty things about me as well as about daughter Sonakshi Sinha," he stated. Shatrughan had demanded justice for KRK after he was arrested over the derogatory tweets he tweeted in 2020 and later in a molestation case in 2021.

362.title: Kim Kardashian to pay $1.26 mn to settle charges linked to crypto promo on her Insta
362.article_body: Kim Kardashian has agreed to settle charges of unlawfully touting a crypto security and to pay $1.26 million in penalties, disgorgement and interest, the US SEC said. Kardashian failed to disclose that she was paid $250,000 to publish a post about EMAX tokens, the crypto asset security being offered by EthereumMax on her Instagram account, the SEC stated.

363.title: Sarfaraz Khan scores 1 more than Don Bradman after 43 first-class innings
363.article_body: Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan has scored 2,928 runs after 43 first-class innings. The 24-year old scored 138(178) in his 43rd first-class innings, while representing Rest of India against Saurashtra in Irani Cup. Sarfaraz has scored one more run than Don Bradman after 43 first-class innings. Vinod Kambli holds record for most runs (3,109) after 43 first-class innings.

364.title: BSNL to start rolling out 4G network from November
364.article_body: State-owned telecom firm BSNL will begin rolling out its 4G network from November this year, the company's Chairman and Managing Director PK Purwar said on Monday. BSNL plans to roll out almost 1.25 lakh 4G mobile sites in 18 months, he added. He also said that BSNL is on its path to launch its 5G network by August 15, 2023.

365.title: Richa & Ali Fazal dance to 'Ambarsariya' during sangeet, video surfaces
365.article_body: A video showing actors Ali Fazal and Richa Chadha dancing at their mehendi and sangeet ceremony has surfaced online. The couple danced to the songs 'Ranjha Ranjha' and 'Ambarsariya' from the films 'Raavan' and 'Fukrey', respectively. Ali and Richa will reportedly get married in the first week of October in the presence of family and friends.

366.title: Stanford dropout's global neobanking firm Vance raises $5.8 mn
366.article_body: Cross-border neobanking platform Vance has raised $5.8 million in a seed funding round led by Hummingbird Ventures and saw participation from Global Founders Capital, YCombinator and Soma Capital. Angel investors such as Alan Rutledge and Gokul Rajaram also participated. Founded by Stanford dropout Parth Garg in 2022, the company aims to build an all-encompassing banking platform for its users.

367.title: PhonePe moves domicile from Singapore to India ahead of IPO
367.article_body: Ahead of its plan to launch an initial public offering (IPO), Walmart and Flipkart-owned PhonePe has shifted its domicile from Singapore to India. Over the past year, PhonePe shifted all businesses and subsidiaries of PhonePe Singapore to PhonePe Pvt Ltd (India), along with creating a new employee stock ownership plan (ESOP). PhonePe is aiming to go public by 2023.

368.title: Delhi HC asks woman to provide sanitary napkins to a school in return for quashing FIR
368.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed a woman to provide sanitary napkins to a girls' school for two months as condition for quashing FIR registered against her for extortion and criminal intimidation after the parties settled dispute amongst them. The additional public prosecutor has been directed to identify a school. The woman's case pertained to her refusing to pay an advocate.

369.title: Nobel Prize winner Svante Pääbo's father was also a Nobel winner
369.article_body: Sweden's Svante Pääbo, who won the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine on Monday, is the son of a Nobel Prize winner. His father, late Sune K Bergström, was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1982 for his discoveries concerning prostaglandins and related biologically active substances. Pääbo won the Nobel for his discoveries on human evolution.

370.title: €200-mn antitrust fine on Apple, Amazon scrapped by Italian court
370.article_body: An Italian court scrapped a fine of over €200 million imposed by the country’s antitrust authority on Apple and Amazon in 2021 for alleged collusion. The firms had been fined citing alleged anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products. The fine was reduced to €173.3 million earlier this year due to a “material error” in first calculation.

371.title: Hrithik performed wonderfully well, cannot imagine anyone else: Saif on Vedha
371.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who played the role of Vikram in 'Vikram Vedha', said that he never thought about playing Vedha in the film. "Hrithik (Roshan) has performed wonderfully well...You cannot imagine anyone else," he added. Saif further said it was a "very naughty" and "fascinating" character. "It's a beautifully written part...His character was definitely a mind game," Saif said.

372.title: Delhi Police register case against PFI under UAPA
372.article_body: The Delhi Police have registered a case against PFI under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) in Southeast Delhi's Shaheen Bagh Police Station. "Reliable information has been received that certain leaders, members and associates of [PFI]...are secretly conspiring to disrupt public order," reads the FIR. Notably, three PFI offices in Delhi were sealed under UAPA's Section 8.

373.title: Pune doctors urge caution due to overlapping dengue, COVID symptoms
373.article_body: As dengue cases spike across the country, doctors have advised people to take tests to clarify the diagnosis as its symptoms overlap with COVID-19. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), since January, has reported 319 confirmed cases and nearly 3,018 suspected cases of dengue. Since the start of the pandemic, 7,08,815 COVID-19 cases and 9,746 deaths were reported within PMC limits.

374.title: AI designs battery that charges 13% faster than commercial batteries
374.article_body: Researchers have used an artificial intelligence (AI) called 'Dragonfly' to design lithium-ion batteries that charge 13% faster than commercially-available batteries. Scientists at US' Carnegie Mellon University used Dragonfly, and an automated arrangement of lab equipment called 'Clio', to run 42 experiments. Clio-Dragonfly formed six solutions that out-performed an existing electrolyte solution.

375.title: Bengaluru Police urge commuters to dial 112 to report crime on buses
375.article_body: The Bengaluru Police has urged commuters to dial 112 to report incidents of molestation and mobile thefts, among others while travelling in the city buses. The police, along with BMTC officials, pasted stickers of the Namma112 emergency helpline number inside the BMTC buses. The helpline provides help during emergency situations, including police and fire brigade services.

376.title: 'Disrespect to Prez’: Delhi L-G on Kejriwal's absence on Gandhi Jayanti
376.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal, criticising him for being absent from Raj Ghat and Vijay Ghat on the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri. This is not only highly improper but amounts to a deliberate breach of protocol, indicative of disrespect to the Hon'ble President of India, he wrote.

377.title: LIC increases its stake in Dr Reddy's Laboratories to 7.7%
377.article_body: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Ltd (DRL) said that Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has purchased 33.86 lakh shares to increase its stake in the pharmaceutical firm to 7.7%. DRL, in its regulatory filing, said that between June 15, 2022, and September 30, 2022, LIC purchased 33,86,486 shares of DRL, aggregating a 2.034% stake from the open market.

378.title: Indian women's team registers 2nd win in a row at World Team TT C'ships
378.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team registered their second consecutive win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China. They defeated Egypt 3-1 on Monday. Sreeja Akula won both her matches. Diya Chitale lost her match, while Manika Batra won. India are currently second in their group standings. India lost their first tie against Germany.

379.title: Debt-ridden jeweller's decomposed body found in his shop in Thane
379.article_body: A decomposed body of a debt-ridden jeweller was found lying inside his own shop in Thane district's Mumbra. The man was missing for five days, police said, adding that it is yet to be ascertained if the man died by suicide or was murdered by someone. The deceased was identified as Bhava Jain.

380.title: AAP govt wins confidence vote called by CM Bhagwant Mann in Punjab Assembly
380.article_body: The CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government on Monday won the confidence motion moved by Mann in the Assembly. Mann had moved the motion on September 27 while alleging that the BJP was trying to topple his government. After the unanimous win for his government, the CM said, "Operation Lotus [has been] defeated in Punjab."

381.title: A year has passed but Lakhimpur's martyr farmers haven't got justice: Rahul
381.article_body: On the first anniversary of the Lakhimpur Kheri incident where farmers, were killed after a car ran over them, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the "martyr farmers" still haven't been given "justice". "As always the BJP is protecting the criminals...This struggle will not end without providing justice to the food providers," Rahul tweeted.

382.title: 'Be empathetic': Delhi HC urges senior lawyers to be kind to juniors
382.article_body: The Delhi HC has appealed to senior advocates to be "empathetic" and provide enough stipends to their juniors, but rejected a plea that newly enrolled lawyers be paid a minimum stipend of ₹5,000. CJ of Delhi HC Satish Chandra Sharma and Justice Subramonium Prasad said that professionals in other disciplines also faced problems similar to the ones faced by lawyers.

383.title: Vasai man moves court after son dies in e-scooter battery blast
383.article_body: A man on Monday approached a consumer court seeking compensation after his seven-year-old son was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging in Vasai. "I bought the scooter last year in August along with the battery for ₹82,000...The battery had...three-year warranty," the man said.  The boy suffered 70% burn injuries and died on September 30.

384.title: Popular YouTuber 'Dream' reveals his name and face for the first time
384.article_body: Popular YouTuber who runs the YouTube channel 'Dream', which has more than 30 million subscribers, has revealed his face to his millions of fans for the first time in a YouTube video. The YouTuber, best known for his Minecraft videos, introduced himself as Clay, without giving a last name. He won YouTube's Streamy award for gaming in 2020 and 2021.

385.title: 'Blasphemous': BJP on crew filming inside Pak gurdwara with shoes on; shares video
385.article_body: BJP has demanded prompt action in a matter, where a film crew went inside a gurdwara in Pakistan with shoes on and shot a movie without permission. BJP claims this incident has outraged the Sikh community in India. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared a video of the incident and said, "Blasphemous actions continue in Pakistan".

386.title: Delhi govt launches Green War Room to monitor air pollution 24X7
386.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai has launched the first advanced Green War Room to monitor air pollution in the national capital. Rai said, "It will monitor air pollution levels 24X7 and ensure that all necessary measures are taken to curb the pollution." Notably, Green War Room is a part of the 15-point anti-pollution action plan announced by CM Arvind Kejriwal.

387.title: iPhone 14 Pro's camera housing hindering wireless charging: Reports
387.article_body: The large camera housing of Apple's iPhone 14 Pro is hindering its wireless charging capability in some cases, according to reports. Some users had complained that they experience excessive shaking in the phone's camera when using third-party apps. The shaky camera configuration could reportedly be causing problems with wireless charging.

388.title: It will create box office history all over the world: Milap on 'Adipurush'
388.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri took to Twitter and praised the teaser of 'Adipurush', saying the film "will create box office history all over the world". In another Tweet, the 'Satyameva Jayate 2' director wrote, "Kids, teenagers, adults, EVERYONE will rush to...cinemas for this film." 'Adipurush', starring Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon, will be released in multiple languages in 2023.

389.title: BJP leader suspended for sharing selfie with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann
389.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Kishansinh Solanki has been suspended for sharing a selfie with AAP leader and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. Solanki was suspended by BJP for "anti-party activities", hours after he posted the picture. Solanki has been suspended for a period of six years, a statement issued by Gujarat BJP said.

390.title: Punjab man gets ₹7,000 compensation after being served worm-ridden pizza
390.article_body: A consumer court has awarded a man ₹7,000 compensation after he was served a worm-ridden pizza in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. The man had reportedly found white worms inside the pizza and later developed acute pain in the stomach and loose stools. Pizza chain Captain Sam's and food delivery app Uber Eats have been directed to pay the amount within 45 days.

391.title: Hrithik performs 'Ek Pal Ka...' hook step with Falguni, video surfaces
391.article_body: Hrithik Roshan and Falguni Pathak danced together at a Navratri event on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, the actor could also be seen doing 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' hook step with Falguni. Reacting to Falguni doing the hook step, a fan wrote, "She is actually dancing better than him." "New type of Garba," another fan wrote.

392.title: Foreign Minister Jaishankar is a JNU boneless wonder: Swamy
392.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy said that Union External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is a "boneless wonder" of the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). "He certainly cannot negotiate with hard-nosed Americans," Swamy tweeted. He added, "His (Jaishankar's) dare is a joke in [the] US. The Americans across the board ignored it. Jaishankar has thus cheapened and lowered India internationally."

393.title: 27-year-old man passes away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai
393.article_body: A 27-year-old man identified as Rishabh passed away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai. The man fell down after experiencing chest pain and was admitted to a nearby hospital, where he was pronounced dead. He was a resident of Dombivili West and worked at a private company.

394.title: No competition with Nagarjuna: Chiranjeevi on Godfather-The Ghost clash
394.article_body: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' and Nagarjuna's 'The Ghost' will release on October 5. Reacting to the clash, Chiranjeevi has said, "There's no competition with Nagarjuna." "Both the films are unique and we're trying to showcase our talent in it and prove ourselves," Chiranjeevi added. Last week, Nagarjuna had said both films should hopefully be a hit at the box office.

395.title: Indian men's team wins 3rd straight match at World Team TT Championships
395.article_body: Indian men's team beat Kazakhstan 3-2 to register their third straight win in Group 2 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China, on Monday. India were 2-1 ahead, before Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost his second match. Harmeet Desai won the last match to help the team win the tie. India are currently on top of their group standings.

396.title: 2 teenage sisters go missing in UP; uniform, bicycle found on roadside
396.article_body: Two teenage sisters, aged 13 and 14, went missing from UP's Barabanki after leaving home for school, police said on Monday. Their clothes and cycles were found on the roadside, following which police launched a search. The girls left home at 8:00 am and their belongings were found at about 8:45 am, after which the villagers informed the police.

397.title: Pune ACB arrests police officer for demanding bribe of ₹1 lakh
397.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested a police sub-inspector for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹1 lakh from an accused in a criminal case. The ACB received a complaint against the sub-inspector and an advocate through whom he demanded the bribe from an accused in a criminal case. The advocate was also booked.

398.title: Family behind cooler maker Symphony buys ₹72.85 crore apartment in Mumbai
398.article_body: The family of air cooler-making company Symphony Limited's Founder, Achal Bakeri, has bought a luxury apartment in Mumbai for ₹72.85 crore, Moneycontrol reported. Achal Bakeri Family Trust and Achal Anil Bakeri, represented by Rupa Achal Bakeri, bought the apartment, the documents showed. Spread across 7,762 sq ft, the property is located in Oberoi Three Sixty West, Worli.

399.title: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' earns ₹17 lakh from single screening in the US
399.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' collected around $21,000 (approximately ₹17,17,000) after a single show in the Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles. As per Deadline, the 932-seat theatre was sold out within 20 minutes. Rajamouli also received a standing ovation after the film's screening. 'RRR', which had released in March, has already earned over ₹1,000 crore worldwide.

400.title: Mumbai Police arrests 4 for cheating businessman posing as CBI officers
400.article_body: Goregaon Police arrested four people for cheating a Mumbai-based businessman by posing as CBI officers. One of the accused had promised the man a ₹1.6 crore loan if the victim provided him with a ₹5 lakh commission. The accused then claimed to be CBI officers and ‘questioned’ the victim, ultimately demanding that he pay the ₹5 lakh as a bribe.

401.title: Mumbai Customs seizes 9.1 kg gold worth ₹4.53 crore over two days
401.article_body: Customs at Mumbai's International Airport seized a total of 9.1 kg of smuggled gold worth ₹4.53 crore in six cases over two days. The largest haul came from an Indian passenger from Dubai who was carrying 4.5 kg of gold dust valued at ₹2.14 crore. Officials also caught 1.4 kg of 24-carat gold bars worth ₹72.79 lakh from a flight.

402.title: U-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal wins gold on National Games debut
402.article_body: Under-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal won the gold medal in the women's 53-kg final at 36th National Games in Gujarat on Sunday. Haryana's Antim beat Priyanshi Prajapati of Madhya Pradesh by fall in the final of her maiden National Games. Antim became the first-ever Indian woman to win gold at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships in August.

403.title: Optus confirms personal info of 1.2 mn users leaked in cyberattack
403.article_body: Optus on Monday confirmed that personal information and at least one valid form of identification of about 1.2 million users was compromised due to a cyberattack late last month. The cyberattack also affected expired IDs and personal information of about 900,000 customers, Optus added.  "The exposed information didn't contain valid...document ID numbers for some 7.7 million customers," it said.

404.title: Never let gender come in the way of ambitions: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
404.article_body: While addressing an event organised by NGO Yuva Unstoppable, Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said gender must not come in the way of ambitions. "My parents always told me that just because I'm a girl doesn't mean I cannot dream big," she said. Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, who won Padma Bhushan in 2005, has a net worth of $2.8 billion, according to Forbes.

405.title: US and Philippines begin 2-week joint naval exercises
405.article_body: The armed forces of the US and Philippines launched joint naval drills on Monday. The "Cooperation of the warriors of the sea" or "KAMANDAG" is a two-week exercise which involves 2,550 American and 530 Filipino troops. Japan and South Korea will join the drills as observers. The US and Philippines are a part of a 70-year-old Mutual Defence Treaty.
